tag.name: cfabort
tag.help: Stops the processing of a CFML page at the tag location. CFML returns everything that was processed before the tag. The tag is often used with conditional logic to stop processing a page when a condition occurs.

parameter.name: showerror
parameter.help: Error to display, in a standard CFML error page, when tag executes

tag.name: cfapplet
tag.help:
This tag references a registered custom Java applet. To register a Java applet, in the CFML Administrator, click Extensions \ Java Applets.
Using this tag within a cfform tag is optional. If you use it within cfform, and the method attribute is defined in the Administrator, the return value is incorporated into the form.

parameter.name: appletsource
parameter.help: Name of registered applet

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Form variable name for applet

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Control's height, in pixels.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Control's width, in pixels.

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Vertical margin above and below control, in pixels.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of control, in pixels.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Alignment

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help:
Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled. Default: "Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!"

values.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

tag.name: cfapplication
tag.help: Defines the scope of a CFML application; enables and disables storage of Client variables; specifies the Client variable storage mechanism; enables Session variables; and sets Application variable timeouts.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of application. Up to 64 characters

parameter.name: clientmanagement
parameter.help: enables client variables

parameter.name: clientstorage
parameter.help: How client variables are stored * datasource_name: in ODBC or native data source. You must create storage repository in the Administrator. * registry: in the system registry. * cookie: on client computer in a cookie. Scalable. If client disables cookies in the browser, client variables do not work

parameter.name: setclientcookies
parameter.help: No: CFML does not automatically send CFID and CFTOKEN cookies to client browser; you must manually code CFID and CFTOKEN on the URL for every page that uses Session or Client variables

parameter.name: sessionmanagement
parameter.help: enables session variables

parameter.name: sessiontimeout
parameter.help: Lifespan of session variables. CreateTimeSpan function and values in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, separated by commas

parameter.name: applicationtimeout
parameter.help: Lifespan of application variables. CreateTimeSpan function and values in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, separated by commas.

parameter.name: setdomaincookies
parameter.help: Yes: Sets CFID and CFTOKEN cookies for a domain (not a host) Required, for applications running on clusters.

parameter.name: scriptprotect
parameter.help: Specifies whether to protect variables from cross-site scripting attacks. - none: do not protect variables - all: protect Form, URL, CGI, and Cookie variables - comma-delimited list of ColdFusion scopes: protect variables in the specified scopes

tag.name: cfargument
tag.help: Creates a parameter definition within a component definition. Defines a function argument. Used within a cffunction tag.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: An argument name.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: a type name; data type of the argument.

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: Whether the parameter is required to execute the component method.

parameter.name: default
parameter.help: If no argument is passed, specifies a default argument value.

parameter.name: displayname
parameter.help: Meaningful only for CFC method parameters. A value to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC.

parameter.name: hint
parameter.help: Meaningful only for CFC method parameters. Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. The hint attribute value follows the displayname attribute value in the parameter description line. This attribute can be useful for describing the purpose of the parameter

tag.name: cfassociate
tag.help: Allows subtag data to be saved with a base tag. Applies only to custom tags.

parameter.name: basetag
parameter.help: Base tag name

parameter.name: datacollection
parameter.help: Structure in which base tag stores subtag data

tag.name: cfbreak
tag.help: Used within a cfloop tag. Breaks out of a loop.

tag.name: cfcache
tag.help:
Stores a copy of a page on the server and/or client computer, to improve page rendering performance. To do this, the tag creates temporary files that contain the static HTML returned from a CFML page.
Use this tag if it is not necessary to get dynamic content each time a user accesses a page. You can use this tag for simple URLs and for URLs that contain URL parameters.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: * cache: server-side and client-side caching. * flush: refresh cached page(s). * clientcache: browser-side caching only. To cache a personalized page, use this option. * servercache: server-side caching only. Not recommended. * optimal: same as "cache".

parameter.name: directory
parameter.help: Absolute path of cache directory.

parameter.name: Timespan
parameter.help: Absolute path of cache directory.

parameter.name: expireurl
parameter.help: Used with action = "flush". A URL reference. CFML matches it against the mappings in the specified cache directory. Can include wildcards. For example: "*/view.cfm?id=*".

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: A username

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: A password

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Remote port to which to connect

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.help: Protocol that is used to create URL from cache.

tag.name: cfcalendar
tag.help: Puts an interactive Macromedia Flash format calendar in an HTML or Flash form. Not supported in XML format forms. The calendar lets a user select a date for submission as a form variable.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the calendar.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: The vertical dimension of the calendar specified in pixels.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: The horizontal dimension of the calendar specified in pixels.

parameter.name: selecteddate
parameter.help: The date that is initially selected. It is highlighted in a color determined by the form skin. Must be in mm/dd/yyyy or dd/mm/yyyy format, depending on the current locale. (Use the setlocale tag to set the locale, if necessary.)

parameter.name: startrange
parameter.help: The start of a range of dates that are disabled. Users cannot select dates from this date through the date specified by the endRange attribute.

parameter.name: endrange
parameter.help: The end of a range of dates that are disabled. Users cannot select dates from the date specified by the startRange attribute through this date.

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.help: Disables all user input, making the control read only. To disable input, specify disabled without an attribute or disabled="true". To enable input, omit the attribute or specify disabled="false". Default is: false

parameter.name: mask
parameter.help: A pattern that specifies the format of the submitted date. Mask characters are: - D = day, can use 0-2 mask characters - M = month, can use 0-4 mask characters - Y = year, can use 0, 2, or 4 characters - E = day in week, can use 0-4 characters - Any other character = put the character in the specified location Default is: MM/DD/YYYY

parameter.name: firstdayofweek
parameter.help: Integer in the range 0-6 specifying the first day of the week in the calendar, 0 indicates Sunday, 6 indicates Saturday. Default is: 0

parameter.name: daynames
parameter.help: A comma-delimited list that sets the names of the weekdays displayed in the calendar. Sunday is the first day and the rest of the weekday names follow in the normal order. Default is: S,M,T,W,Th,F,S

parameter.name: monthnames
parameter.help: A comma-delimited list of the month names that are displayed at the top of the calendar.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.help: Flash only: Specifying whether the control is enabled. A disabled control appears in light gray. This is the inverse of the disabled attribute.

parameter.name: visible
parameter.help: Flash only: Specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank.

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: Flash only: Actionscript style or styles to apply to the calendar. Default is: haloGreen

parameter.name: onchange
parameter.help: Flash only: ActionScript that runs when the user selects a date.

tag.name: cfcase
tag.help: Used only inside the cfswitch tag body. Contains code to execute when the expression specified in the cfswitch tag has one or more specific values.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The value or values that the expression attribute of the cfswitch tag must match. To specify multiple matching values, separate the values with the delimiter character. The value or values must be simple constants or constant expressions, not variables.

parameter.name: delimiters
parameter.help: Specifies the delimiter character or characters that separate multiple values to match. If you specify multiple delimiter characters, you can use any of them to separate the values to be matched.

tag.name: cfcatch
tag.help: Used inside a cftry tag. Together, they catch and process exceptions in CFML pages. Exceptions are events that disrupt the normal flow of instructions in a CFML page, such as failed database operations, missing include files, and developer-specified events.

tag.name: cfchart
tag.help: Generates and displays a chart.

parameter.name: format
parameter.help: File format in which to save graph.

parameter.name: chartheight
parameter.help: Chart height; integer number of pixels

parameter.name: chartwidth
parameter.help: Chart width; integer number of pixels

parameter.name: scalefrom
parameter.help: Y-axis minimum value; integer

parameter.name: scaleto
parameter.help: Y-axis max value; integer

parameter.name: showxgridlines
parameter.help: yes: display X-axis gridlines

parameter.name: showygridlines
parameter.help: yes: display Y-axis gridlines

parameter.name: gridlines
parameter.help: Number of grid lines to display on value axis, including axis; positive integer.

parameter.name: seriesplacement
parameter.help: Applies to charts that have more than one data series. Relative positions of series.

parameter.name: foregroundcolor
parameter.help: color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: backgroundcolor
parameter.help: Color of the area between the data background and the chart border, around labels and around the legend. Hexadecimal value or supported named color. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: databackgroundcolor
parameter.help: color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font of data in column.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Size of text in column.

parameter.name: fontitalic
parameter.help: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

parameter.name: fontbold
parameter.help: Yes: displays grid control text in bold

parameter.name: labelformat
parameter.help: Format for Y-axis labels.

parameter.name: xaxistitle
parameter.help: text; X-axis title

parameter.name: yaxistitle
parameter.help: text; X-axis title

parameter.name: xaxistype
parameter.help: * category The axis indicates the data category. Data is sorted according to the sortXAxis attribute. * scale The axis is numeric. All cfchartdata item attribute values must numeric. The X axis is automatically sorted numerically.

parameter.name: yaxistype
parameter.help: Currently has no effect, as Y axis is always used for data values. Valid values are category and scale

parameter.name: sortxaxis
parameter.help: Display column labels in alphabetic order along X-axis. Ignored if the xAxisType attribute is scale.

parameter.name: show3d
parameter.help: Display chart with three-dimensional appearance.

parameter.name: xoffset
parameter.help: Applies if show3D="yes". Number of units by which to display the chart as angled, horizontally

parameter.name: yoffset
parameter.help: Applies if show3D="yes". Number of units by which to display the chart as angled, horizontally.

parameter.name: rotated
parameter.help:
This attribute is deprecated.
yes: rotate chart 90 degrees. For a horizontal bar chart, use this option.

parameter.name: showlegend
parameter.help: yes: if chart contains more than one data series, display legend

parameter.name: tipstyle
parameter.help: Determines the action that opens a popup window to display information about the current chart element. * mouseDown: display if the user positions the cursor at the element and clicks the mouse. Applies only to Flash format graph files. * mouseOver: displays if the user positions the cursor at the element * none: suppresses display

parameter.name: tipbgcolor
parameter.help: color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: showmarkers
parameter.help: Applies to chartseries type attribute values line, curve and scatter. yes: display markers at data points

parameter.name: markersize
parameter.help: Size of data point marker. in pixels. Integer.

parameter.name: pieslicestyle
parameter.help: Applies to chartseries type attribute value pie.

parameter.name: URL
parameter.help:
URL to open if the user clicks item in a data series; the onClick destination page.
You can specify variables within the URL string; ColdFusion passes current values of the variables. * $VALUE$: the value of the selected row. If none, the value is an empty string. * $ITEMLABEL$: the label of the selected item. If none, the value is an empty string. * $SERIESLABEL$: the label of the selected series. If none, the value is an empty string.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Page variable name. String. Generates the the graph as binary data and assigns it to the specified variable. Suppresses chart display. You can use the name value in the cffile tag to write the chart to a file.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: XML file or string to use to specify the style of the chart.

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: Title of the chart.

tag.name: cfchartdata
tag.help: Used with the cfchart and cfchartseries tags. This tag defines chart data points. Its data is submitted to the cfchartseries tag.

parameter.name: item
parameter.help: string; data point name

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: number or expression; data point value

tag.name: cfchartseries
tag.help: Used with the cfchart tag. This tag defines the style in which chart data displays: bar, line, pie, and so on.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Sets the chart display style

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Name of CFML query from which to get data.

parameter.name: itemcolumn
parameter.help: Name of a column in the query specified in the query attribute; contains the item label for a data point to graph.

parameter.name: valuecolumn
parameter.help: Name of a column in the query specified in the query attribute; contains data values to graph.

parameter.name: serieslabel
parameter.help: Text of data series label

parameter.name: seriescolor
parameter.help:
Color of the main element (such as the bars) of a chart. For a pie chart, the color of the first slice.
Hex value or supported named color; see name list in the cfchart Usage section. For a hex value, use the form "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two pound signs or none.

parameter.name: paintstyle
parameter.help: Sets the paint display style of the data series.

parameter.name: markerstyle
parameter.help: Applies to chartseries type attribute values line, curve and scatter, and show3D attribute value no.

parameter.name: colorlist
parameter.help:
Applies if chartseries type attribute = "pie". Sets pie slice colors.
Comma-delimited list of hex values or supported, named web colors; see name list in the cfchart Usage section.
For a hex value, use the form "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two pound signs or none.

parameter.name: datalabelstyle
parameter.help: Specifies the way in which the color is applied to the item in the series: - None = nothing is printed (default) - Value = the value of the datapoint - Rowlabel = the row's label - Columnlabel = the column's label - Pattern

tag.name: cfcol
tag.help: Defines table column header, width, alignment, and text. Used within a cftable tag.

parameter.name: header
parameter.help: Column header text. To use this attribute, you must also use the cftable colHeaders attribute.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Column width. If the length of data displayed exceeds this value, data is truncated to fit. To avoid this, use an HTML table tag.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Column alignment

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: Double-quotation mark-delimited text; determines what to display. Rules: same as for cfoutput sections. You can embed hyperlinks, image references, and input controls

tag.name: cfcollection
tag.help:
Creates, registers, and administers Verity search engine collections.
A collection that is created with the cfcollection tag is internal. A collection created any other way is external.
A collection that is registered with CFML using the cfcollection tag or registered with the K2 Server by editing the k2server.ini file is registered. Other collections are unregistered.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: categorylist: retrieves categories from the collection and indicates how many documents are in each one. Returns a structure of structures in which the category representing each substructure is associated with a number of documents. For a category in a category tree, the number of documents is the number at or below that level in the tree. create: registers the collection with CFML. - If the collection is present: creates a map to it - If the collection is not present: creates it delete: unregisters a collection. - If the collection was registered with action = create: deletes its directories - If the collection was registered and mapped: does not delete collection directories optimize: optimizes the structure and contents of the collection for searching; recovers space. list: returns a query result set, named from the name attribute value, of the attributes of the collections that are registered by CFML and K2 Server. map: creates a map to the collection. It is not necessary to specify this value. Deprecated in CF7. repair: fixes data corruption in a collection. Deprecated in CF7.

parameter.name: collection
parameter.help: A collection name. The name can include spaces

parameter.name: path
parameter.help: Absolute path to a Verity collection.

parameter.name: language
parameter.help: Options are listed in Usage section. Requires the appropriate (European or Asian) Verity Locales language pack.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for the query results returned by the list action.

parameter.name: categories
parameter.help: Used only for creating a collection: - true: This collection includes support for categories. - false: This collection does not support categories. Default.

tag.name: cfcomponent
tag.help: Creates and defines a component object; encloses functionality that you build in CFML and enclose within cffunction tags. This tag contains one or more cffunction tags that define methods. Code within the body of this tag, other than cffunction tags, is executed when the component is instantiated.

parameter.name: extends
parameter.help: Name of parent component from which to inherit methods and properties.

parameter.name: output
parameter.help: Specifies whether constructor code in the component can generate HTML output; does not affect output in the body of cffunction tags in the component.

parameter.name: displayname
parameter.help: A string to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. The information appears on the heading, following the component name. If the style attribute is set to document, the displayname attribute is used as the name of the service element in the WSDL.

parameter.name: hint
parameter.help: Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. The hint attribute value appears below the component name heading. This attribute can be useful for describing the purpose of the parameter. If the style attribute is set to document, the hint attribute is used as the document element of the service in the WSDL.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for the component

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: Specifies whether a CFC used for web services uses RPC-encoded style or document-literal style: - rpc: RPC-encoded style, default - document: Document-literal style If you specify document, you must also specify the namespace, serviceportname, porttypename, and bindingname attributes.

parameter.name: namespace
parameter.help: Specifies the namespace used in the WSDL when using the CFC as a document-literal style web service. If you don't specify this attribute, ColdFusion MX derives the namespace from the CFC class name. This attribute applies only when style="document".

parameter.name: serviceportname
parameter.help: Specifies the name of the port element in the WSDL. This attribute applies only when style="document".

parameter.name: porttypename
parameter.help: Specifies the name of the porttype element in the WSDL. This attribute applies only when style="document".

parameter.name: bindingname
parameter.help: Specifies the name of the binding element in the WSDL. This attribute applies only when style="document".

parameter.name: wsdlfile
parameter.help: A properly formatted WSDL file to be used instead of WSDL generated by ColdFusion MX. This attribute applies only when style="document".

tag.name: cfcontent
tag.help: Does either or both of the following: * Sets the MIME content encoding header for the current page * Sends the contents of a file from the server as the page output

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The MIME content type of the page, optionally followed by a semicolon and the character encoding. By default, CFML sends pages as text/html content type in the UTF-8 character encoding.

parameter.name: deletefile
parameter.help:
Applies only if you specify a file with the file attribute.
Yes: deletes the file on the server after sending its contents to the client. No: leaves the file on the server.

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: Name of file whose contents will be the page output. When using CFML in a distributed configuration, the file attribute must refer to a path on the system on which the web server runs. When you use this attribute, any other output on the current CFML page is ignored; only the contents of the file is sent to the client.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Name of a ColdFusion MX binary variable whose contents can be displayed by the browser, such as the contents of a chart generated by the cfchart tag or a PDF or Excel file retrieved by a cffile action="readBinary" tag. When you use this attribute, any other output on the current CFML page is ignored; only the contents of the file are sent to the client.

parameter.name: reset
parameter.help:
The reset and file attributes are mutually exclusive. If you specify a file, this attribute has no effect.
Yes: discards output that precedes call to cfcontent No: preserves output that precedes call to cfcontent. In this case all output is sent with the specified type.

tag.name: cfcookie
tag.help: Defines web browser cookie variables, including expiration and security options.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of cookie variable. CFML converts cookie names to all-uppercase. Cookie names set using this tag can include any printable ASCII characters except commas, semicolons or white space characters.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value to assign to cookie variable. Must be a string or variable that can be stored as a string.

parameter.name: expires
parameter.help:
Expiration of cookie variable.
* The default: the cookie expires when the user closes the browser, that is, the cookie is "session only". * A date or date/time object (for example, 10/09/97) * A number of days (for example, 10, or 100) * now: deletes cookie from client cookie.txt file (but does not delete the corresponding variable the Cookie scope of the active page). * never: The cookie expires in 30 years from the time it was created (effectively never in web years).

parameter.name: secure
parameter.help: If browser does not support Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) security, the cookie is not sent. To use the cookie, the page must be accessed using the https protocol.

parameter.name: path
parameter.help:
URL, within a domain, to which the cookie applies; typically a directory. Only pages in this path can use the cookie. By default, all pages on the server that set the cookie can access the cookie.
path = "/services/login"

parameter.name: domain
parameter.help:
Domain in which cookie is valid and to which cookie content can be sent from the user's system. By default, the cookie is only available to the server that set it. Use this attribute to make the cookie available to other servers.
Must start with a period. If the value is a subdomain, the valid domain is all domain names that end with this string. This attribute sets the available subdomains on the site upon which the cookie can be used.

tag.name: cfdefaultcase
tag.help: Used only inside the cfswitch tag body. Contains code to execute when the expression specified in the cfswitch tag does not match any of the values specified by preceeding cfcase tags.

tag.name: cfdirectory
tag.help: Manages interactions with directories. Different combos cause different attributes to be required.

parameter.name: directory
parameter.help: Absolute pathname of directory against which to perform action.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for output record set.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.help: File extension filter applied to returned names. For example: *.cfm. One filter can be applied.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.help: Applies only to UNIX and Linux. Permissions. Octal values of Unix chmod command. Assigned to owner, group, and other, respectively.

parameter.name: sort
parameter.help: Query column(s) by which to sort directory listing. Delimited list of columns from query output.

parameter.name: newdirectory
parameter.help: New name for directory.

parameter.name: recurse
parameter.help: Whether ColdFusion performs the action on subdirectories.

tag.name: cfdiv
tag.help: Creates an HTML tag with specified contents and lets you to use bind expressions to dynamically control the tag contents.

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: The HTML ID attribute value to assign to the generated container tag.

parameter.name: onBindError
parameter.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message. If you omit this attribute, and have specified a global error handler (by using the ColdFusion.setGlobalErrorHandler function), it displays the error message; otherwise a default error pop-up displays.

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: A URL that returns the container contents. ColdFusion uses standard page path resolution rules. Note: If a CFML page specified in this attribute contains tags that use AJAX features, such as cfform, cfgrid, and cfwindow, you must use a cfajaximport tag on the page with the cfpod tag. For more information, see cfajaximport.

parameter.name: tagName
parameter.help: The HTML container tag to create.

tag.name: cfdocument
tag.help: Creates PDF or FlashPaper output from a text block containing CFML and HTML.

parameter.name: format
parameter.help: Specifies the report format.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.help: Specifies the fully qualified path name of a file to contain the PDF or FlashPaper output. If you omit the filename attribute, ColdFusion MX streams output to the browser.

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.help: Specifies whether ColdFusion MX overwrites an existing file. Used in conjunction with filename. Default is: false

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Specifies the name of an existing variable into which the tag stores the PDF or FlashPaper output.

parameter.name: pagetype
parameter.help: Specifies the page size into which ColdFusion generates the report. - legal: 8.5 inches x 14 inches - letter: 8.5 inches x 11 inches - A4: 8.27 inches x 11.69 inches - A5: 5.81 inches x 8.25 inches - B5: 9.81 inches x 13.88 inches - Custom: Custom height and width. If you specify custom, you must also specify the pageheight and pagewidth attributes, can optionally specify margin attributes, and can optionally specify whether the units are inches or centimeters.

parameter.name: pageheight
parameter.help: Specifies the page height in inches (default) or centimeters. This attribute is only valid if pagetype=custom. To specify page height in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

parameter.name: pagewidth
parameter.help: Specifies the page width in inches (default) or centimeters. This attribute is only valid if pagetype=custom. To specify page width in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.help: Specifies the page orientation. Specify either of the following: - portrait (default) - landscape

parameter.name: margintop
parameter.help: Specifies the top margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify top margin in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

parameter.name: marginbottom
parameter.help: Specifies the bottom margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify bottom margin in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

parameter.name: marginleft
parameter.help: Specifies the left margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify left margin in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

parameter.name: marginright
parameter.help: Specifies the right margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify right margin in centimeters, include the unit=cm attribute.

parameter.name: unit
parameter.help: Specifies the default unit (inches or centimeters) for pageheight, pagewidth, and margin attributes.

parameter.name: encryption
parameter.help: Specifies whether the output is encrypted (format="PDF" only). Default is: none

parameter.name: ownerpassword
parameter.help: Specifies an owner password (format="PDF" only).

parameter.name: userpassword
parameter.help: Specifies a user password (format="PDF" only).

parameter.name: permissions
parameter.help: Specifies one or more permissions (format="PDF" only). Separate multiple permissions with a comma.

parameter.name: fontembed
parameter.help: Specifies whether ColdFusion embeds fonts in the output. Specify one of the following: - true: Embed fonts - false: Do not embed fonts. Selective: Embed all fonts except Java fonts and core fonts.

parameter.name: backgroundvisible
parameter.help: Specifies whether the background prints when the user prints the document: - yes: include the background when printing. - no: do not include the background when printing.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.help: Specifies a scale factor as a percentage. Use this option to reduce the size of the HTML output so that it fits on that paper. Specify a number less than 100.

tag.name: cfdocumentitem
tag.help: Specifies action items for a PDF or FlashPaper document created by the cfdocument tag.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Specifies the action: - pagebreak: start a new page at the location of the tag. - header: use the text between the <cfdocumentitem> and </cfdocumentitem> tags as the running header. - footer: use the text between the <cfdocumentitem> and </cfdocumentitem> tags as the running footer.

tag.name: cfdocumentsection
tag.help: Divides a PDF or FlashPaper document into sections. By using this tag in conjunction with a cfdocumentitem tag, each section can have unique headers, footers, and page numbers.

parameter.name: margintop
parameter.help: Specifies the top margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify the top margin in centimeters, include the unit="cm" attribute in the parent cfdocument tag.

parameter.name: marginbottom
parameter.help: Specifies the bottom margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify the bottom margin in centimeters, include the unit="cm" attribute in the parent cfdocument tag.

parameter.name: marginleft
parameter.help: Specifies the left margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify the left margin in centimeters, include the unit="cm" attribute in the parent cfdocument tag.

parameter.name: marginright
parameter.help: Specifies the right margin in inches (default) or centimeters. To specify the right margin in centimeters, include the unit="cm" attribute in the parent cfdocument tag.

tag.name: cfdump
tag.help: Outputs the elements, variables and values of most kinds of CFML objects. Useful for debugging. You can display the contents of simple and complex variables, objects, components, user-defined functions, and other elements.

parameter.name: var
parameter.help: Variable to display. Enclose a variable name in pound signs.

parameter.name: expand
parameter.help: Yes: In Internet Explorer and Mozilla, expands views

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: A string; header for the dump output.

tag.name: cfelse
tag.help: Used as the last control block in a cfif tag block to handle any case not identified by the cfif tag or a cfelseif tag.

tag.name: cfelseif
tag.help: Used as a control block in a cfif tag block to handle any case not identified by the cfif tag or a cfelseif tag.

tag.name: cferror
tag.help: Displays a custom HTML page when an error occurs. This lets you maintain a consistent look and feel among an application's functional and error pages

parameter.name: type
parameter.help:
Type of error that the custom error page handles. The type also determines how CFML handles the error page. For more information, see Specifying a custom error page in Developing CFML MX Applications.
exception: a exception of the type specified by the exception attribute. validation: errors recognized by sever-side type validation. request: any encountered error. monitor: deprecated.

parameter.name: template
parameter.help: Relative path to the custom error page. (A CFML page was formerly called a template.)

parameter.name: mailto
parameter.help: An E-mail address. This attribute is available on the error page as the variable error.mailto. CFML does not automatically send anything to this address.

parameter.name: exception
parameter.help:
Type of exception that the tag handles:
application: application exceptions database: database exceptions template: CFML page exceptions security: security exceptions object: object exceptions missingInclude: missing include file exceptions expression: expression exceptions lock: lock exceptions custom_type: developer-defined exceptions, defined in the cfthrow tag any: all exception types

tag.name: cfexecute
tag.help: Executes a CFML developer-specified process on a server computer.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help:
Absolute path of the application to execute.
On Windows, you must specify an extension; for example, C:\myapp.exe.

parameter.name: arguments
parameter.help: Command-line variables passed to application. If specified as string, it is processed as follows: * Windows: passed to process control subsystem for parsing. * UNIX: tokenized into an array of arguments. The default token separator is a space; you can delimit arguments that have embedded spaces with double quotation marks. If passed as array, it is processed as follows: * Windows: elements are concatenated into a string of tokens, separated by spaces. Passed to process control subsystem for parsing. * UNIX: elements are copied into an array of exec() arguments

parameter.name: outputfile
parameter.help:
File to which to direct program output. If no outputfile or variable attribute is specified, output is displayed on the page from which it was called.
If not an absolute path (starting a with a drive letter and a colon, or a forward or backward slash), it is relative to the CFML temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Variable in which to put program output. If no outputfile or variable attribute is specified, output is displayed on page from which it was called.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Length of time, in seconds, that CFML waits for output from the spawned program.

tag.name: cfexit
tag.help: This tag aborts processing of the currently executing CFML custom tag, exits the page within the currently executing CFML custom tag, or re-executes a section of code within the currently executing CFML custom tag.

parameter.name: method
parameter.help: exittag: aborts processing of currently executing tag exittemplate: exits page of currently executing tag loop: reexecutes body of currently executing tag

tag.name: cffile
tag.help: Manages interactions with server files. Different combonations cause different attributes to be required.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Type of file manipulation that the tag performs.

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: Pathname of the file.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.help: Applies only to UNIX and Linux. Permissions. Octal values of Unix chmod command. Assigned to owner, group, and other, respectively.

parameter.name: output
parameter.help: String to add to the file

parameter.name: addnewline
parameter.help: Yes: appends newline character to text written to file

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.help:
Applies to Windows. A comma-delimited list of attributes to set on the file.
If omitted, the file's attributes are maintained.

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help:
The character encoding in which the file contents is encoded.
For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: Pathname of the file (durring copy).

parameter.name: destination
parameter.help: Pathname of a directory or file on web server (durring copy).

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Name of variable to contain contents of text file.

parameter.name: filefield
parameter.help:
Name of form field used to select the file.
Do not use pound signs (#) to specify the field name.

parameter.name: nameconflict
parameter.help: Action to take if filename is the same as that of a file in the directory.

parameter.name: accept
parameter.help:
Limits the MIME types to accept. Comma-delimited list. For example, to permit JPG and Microsoft Word file uploads:
accept = "image/jpg, application/msword"

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: Allows you to specify a name for the variable in which cffile returns the result (or status) parameters. If you do not specify a value for this attribute, cffile uses the prefix "cffile".

parameter.name: fixnewline
parameter.help: * Yes: changes embedded line-ending characters in string variables to operating-system specific line endings * No: (default) do not change embedded line-ending characters in string variables.

tag.name: cfflush
tag.help: Flushes currently available data to the client.

parameter.name: interval
parameter.help: Flushes output each time this number of bytes becomes available. HTML headers, and data that is already available when the tag is executed, are omitted from the count.

tag.name: cfform
tag.help: Builds a form with CFML custom control tags; these provide more functionality than standard HTML form input elements.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: In HTML format, if you omit this attribute and specify an id attribute, ColdFusion does not include a name attribute in the HTML sent to the browser; this behavior lets you use the cfform tag to create XHTML-compliant forms. If you omit the name attribute and the id attribute, ColdFusion generates a name of the form CFForm_n where n is a number that assigned serially to the forms on a page.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: Name of CFML page to execute when the form is submitted for processing.

parameter.name: method
parameter.help: The method the browser uses to send the form data to the server: - post: Send the data using the HTTP post method, This method sends the data in a separate message to the server. - get: Send the data using the HTTP get method, which puts the form field contents in the URL query string.

parameter.name: format
parameter.help: - HTML: Generate an HTML form and send it to the client. cfgrid and cftree child controls can be in Flash or applet format. - Flash: Generate a Flash form and send it to the client. All controls are in Flash format. - XML: Generate XForms-compliant XML and save the results in a variable specified by the name attribute. By default, ColdFusion also applies an XSL skin and displays the result. For more information, see the skin attribute

parameter.name: skin
parameter.help: Flash: Use a Macromedia halo color to stylize the output. XML: Specfies whether to apply an XSL skin and display the resulting HTML to the client. Can be any of the following: - ColdFusion MX skin name: Apply the specified skin. - XSL file name: Apply the skin located in the specified path. - "none": Do not apply an XSL skin. You must use XForms XML then. - (omitted) or "default": Use the ColdFusion MX default skin.

parameter.name: preservedata
parameter.help: When the cfform action attribute posts back to the same page as the form, this determines whether to override the control values with the submitted values. - false: values specified in the control tag attributes are used - true: corresponding submitted values are used

parameter.name: onload
parameter.help: JavaScript to execute when the form loads.

parameter.name: onsubmit
parameter.help: JavaScript or Actionscript function to execute to preprocess data before form is submitted. If any child tags specify onSubmit field validation, ColdFusion does the validation before executing this JavaScript.

parameter.name: codebase
parameter.help: URL of downloadable JRE plug-in (for Internet Explorer only). Default: /CFIDE/classes/cf-j2re-win.cab

parameter.name: archive
parameter.help: URL of downloadable Java classes for CFML controls. Default: /CFIDE/classes/cfapplets.jar

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: The height of the form. Use a number to specify pixels, In Flash, you can use a percentage value to specify a percentage of the available width. The displayed height might be less than the specified size.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: The width of the form. Use a number to specify pixels, In Flash, you can use a percentage value to specify a percentage of the available width.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: Applies only for onSubmit or onBlur validation; has no effect for onServer validation. An ActionScript expression or expressions to execute if the user submits a form with one or more validation errors.

parameter.name: wmode
parameter.help: Specifies how the Flash form appears relative to other displayable content that occupies the same space on an HTML page. - window: The Flash form is the topmost layer on the page and obscures anything that would share the space, such as drop-down dynamic HTML lists. - transparent: The Flash form honors the z-index of dhtml so you can float items above it. If the Flash form is above any item, transparent regions in the form show the content that is below it. - opaque: The Flash form honors the z-index of dhtml so you can float items above it. If the Flash form is above any item, it blocks any content that is below it. Default is: window.

parameter.name: accessible
parameter.help: Specifies whether to include support screen readers in the Flash form. Screen reader support adds approximately 80KB to the SWF file sent to the client. Default is: false.

parameter.name: preloader
parameter.help: Specifies whether to display a progress bar when loading the Flash form. Default is: true.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Integer number of seconds for which to keep the form data in the Flash cache on the server. A value of 0 prevents the data from being cached.

parameter.name: scriptsrc
parameter.help: Specifies the URL, relative to the web root, of the directory that contains the cfform.js file with the client-side JavaScript used by this tag and its child tags. For XML format forms, this directory is also the default directory for XSLT skins.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: Styles to apply to the form. In HTML or XML format, ColdFusion passes the style attribute to the browser or XML. In Flash format, must be a style specification in CSS format.

parameter.name: onreset
parameter.help: JavaScript to execute when the user clicks a reset button.

parameter.name: enctype
parameter.help: MIME type passed through to <FORM>.

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: HTML id passed through to <FORM>.

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: Target window or frame passed through to <FORM>.

parameter.name: class
parameter.help: Form CSS class passed through to <FORM>.

parameter.name: passthrough
parameter.help:
This attribute is deprecated.
Passes arbitrary attribute-value pairs to the HTML code that is generated for the tag. You can use either of the following formats:
passthrough="title=""myTitle""" passthrough='title="mytitle"'

parameter.name: enablecab
parameter.help: This attribute is deprecated.

tag.name: cfformgroup
tag.help: Creates a container control for multiple form controls. Used in the cfform tag body of Macromedia Flash and XML forms. Ignored in HTML forms.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: For XML forms can be any XForms group type defined in the XSLT. For Flash see the value options and docs for more information.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: The query to use with the repeater. Flash creates an instance of each of the cfformgroup tag's child tags for each row in the query. You can use the bind attribute in the child tags to use data from the query row for the instance.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: Used only for the repeater type; ignored otherwise. Specifies the row number of the first row of the query to use in the Flash form repeater. This attribute is zerobased: the first row is row 0, not row 1 (as in most ColdFusion tags). Default: 0

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Used only for for the repeater type; ignored otherwise. Specifies the maximum number of query rows to use in the Flash form repeater. If the query has more rows than the sum of the startrow attribute and this value, the repeater does not use the remaining rows.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: Label to apply to the form group. In Flash, does the following: - For a page or panel form group, determines the label to put on the corresponding accordion pleat, the tabnavigator tab, or the panel title bar. For a Flash horizontal or vertical form group, specifies the label to put to the left of the group. - Ignored in Flash for repeater, hbox, hdividedbox, vbox, vdividedbox, tile, accordion, and tabnavigator types.

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: ID for form input element.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: Flash: A Flash style specification in CSS format. XML: An inline CSS style specification.

parameter.name: selectedindex
parameter.help: Used only for accordion and tabnavigator types; ignored otherwise. Specifies the page control to display as open, where 0 (not 1) specifies the first page control defined in the group.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Width of the group container, in pixels. If you omit this attribute, Flash automatically sizes the container width. Ignored for Flash repeater type.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Height of the group container, in pixels. If you omit this attribute, Flash automatically sizes the container height. Ignored for Flash repeater type.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the controls in the form group are enabled. Disabled controls appear in light gray. Default: true

parameter.name: visible
parameter.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the controls in the form group are visible. If the controls are invisible, the space that would be occupied by visible controls is blank. Default: true

parameter.name: onchange
parameter.help: Flash only: tabnavigator and accordion types only: ActionScript expression or expressions to execute when a new tab or accordion page is selected. Note: The onChange event occurs when the form first displays.

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers in the form group area. If a control in the form group also specifies a tooltip, Flash displays the control's tolltip when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.

tag.name: cfformitem
tag.help: Inserts a horizontal line, a vertical line, a spacer, or text in a Flash form. Used in the cfform or cfformgroup tag body for Flash and XML forms. Ignored in HTML forms.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Form item type. See docs for more details.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: Flash: Must be a style specification in CSS format. Ignored if the type attribute is html or text. XML: ColdFusion passes the style attribute to the XML. ColdFusion skins include the style attribute to the generated HTML.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Width of the item, in pixels. If you omit this attribute, Flash automatically sizes the width. In ColdFusion XSL skins, use the style attribute, instead.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Height of the item, in pixels. If you omit this attribute, Flash automatically sizes the width. In ColdFusion XSL skins, use the style attribute, instead.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.help: Boolean value specifying whether the control is enabled. Disabled text appear in light gray. Has no effect on spacers and rules. Default: true

parameter.name: visible
parameter.help: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Has no effect on spacers. Default: true

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.help: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control. Has no effect on spacers.

parameter.name: bind
parameter.help: A Flash bind expression that populates the field with information from other form fields. If you use this attribute, ColdFusion MX ignores any text that you specify in the body of the cftextitem tag. This attribute can be useful if the cfformitem tag is in a cfformgroup type="repeater" tag.

tag.name: cfftp
tag.help: Lets users implement File Transfer Protocol (FTP) operations.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: FTP operation to perform. open: create an FTP connection close: terminate an FTP connection

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Overrides username specified in ODBC setup.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Overrides password specified in ODBC setup.

parameter.name: server
parameter.help: FTP server to which to connect; for example, ftp.myserver.com

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Value in seconds for the timeout of all operations, including individual data request operations.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Remote port to which to connect

parameter.name: connection
parameter.help: Name of the FTP connection. If you specify the username, password, and server attributes, and if no connection exists for them, CFML creates one. Calls to cfftp with the same connection name reuse the connection.

parameter.name: proxyserver
parameter.help: The proxy server required to access the URL.

parameter.name: retrycount
parameter.help: Number of retries until failure is reported.

parameter.name: stoponerror
parameter.help: Yes: halts processing, displays an appropriate error. No: populates the error variables

parameter.name: passive
parameter.help: Yes: enable passive mode

parameter.name: asciiextensionist
parameter.help: Delimited list of file extensions that force ASCII transfer mode, if transferMode = "auto".

parameter.name: transfermode
parameter.help: ASCII FTP transfer mode Binary FTP transfer mode Auto FTP transfer mode

parameter.name: failifexists
parameter.help: Yes: if a local file with same name exists, getFile fails

parameter.name: directory
parameter.help: Directory on which to perform an operation

parameter.name: localfile
parameter.help: Name of the file on the local file system

parameter.name: remotefile
parameter.help: Name of the file on the FTP server file system.

parameter.name: item
parameter.help: Object of these actions: file or directory.

parameter.name: existing
parameter.help: Current name of the file or directory on the remote server.

parameter.name: new
parameter.help: New name of file or directory on the remote server

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Query name of directory listing.

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: Specifies a name for the structure in which cfftp stores the returnValue variable. If set, this value replaces cfftp as the prefix to use when accessing returnVariable.

tag.name: cffunction
tag.help: Defines a function that you can call in CFML. Required to defined CFML component methods.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A string; a component method that is used within the cfcomponent tag.

parameter.name: returnformat
parameter.help: The format in which to return values to a remote caller. This attribute has no effect on values returned to a local caller.

parameter.name: returntype
parameter.help: String; a type name; data type of the function return value Required for a web service; Optional, otherwise.

parameter.name: roles
parameter.help: A comma-delimited list of CFML security roles that can invoke the method. Only users who are logged in with the specified roles can execute the function. If this attribute is omitted, all users can invoke the method

parameter.name: access
parameter.help:
The client security context from which the method can be invoked:
private: available only to the component that declares the method and any components that extend the component in which it is defined package: available only to the component that declares the method, components that extend the component, or any other components in the package public: available to a locally executing page or component method remote: available to a locally or remotely executing page or component method, or a remote client through a URL, Flash, or a web service. To publish the function as a web service, this option is required.

parameter.name: output
parameter.help: Specifies under which conditions the function can generate HTML output.

parameter.name: displayname
parameter.help: Meaningful only for CFC method parameters. A value to be displayed in parentheses following the function name when using introspection to show information about the CFC

parameter.name: hint
parameter.help: Meaningful only for CFC method parameters. Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. The hint attribute value follows the syntax line in the function description

parameter.name: description
parameter.help: Supplies a short text description of the function.

tag.name: cfgrid
tag.help: Used within the cfform tag. Puts a grid control (a table of data) in a CFML form. To specify grid columns and row data, use the cfgridcolumn and cfgridrow tags, or use the query attribute, with or without cfgridcolumn tags.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of grid element.

parameter.name: bind
parameter.help: A bind expression specifying used to fill the contents of the grid. Cannot be used with the query attribute.

parameter.name: pagesize
parameter.help: The number of rows to display per page for a dynamic grid. If the number of available rows exceeds the page size, the grid displays only the specified number of entries on a single page, and the user navigates between pages to show all data. The grid retrieves data for each page only when it is required for display. This attribute is ignored if you specify a query attribute.

parameter.name: striperowcolor
parameter.help: The color to use for one of the alternating stripes. The bgColor setting determines the other color

parameter.name: preservepageonsort
parameter.help: Specifies whether to display the page with the current page number, or display page 1, after sorting (or resorting) the grid

parameter.name: striperows
parameter.help: Specifies whether to display the page with the current page number, or display page 1, after sorting (or resorting) the grid

parameter.name: format
parameter.help: - applet: generates a Java applet. - Flash: generates a Flash grid control. - xml: generates an XMLrepresentation of the grid. In XML format forms, includes the generated XML in the form. In HTML format forms, puts the XML in a string variable with the name specified by the name attribute. Default: applet

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Control's height, in pixels. Default for applet: 300

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Control's width, in pixels. Default for applet: 300

parameter.name: autowidth
parameter.help: Yes: sets column widths so that all columns display within grid width. No: sets columns to equal widths. User can resize columns. Horizontal scroll bars are not available, because if you specify a column width and set autoWidth = "Yes", CFML sets to this width, if possible

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Vertical margin above and below control, in pixels.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of control, in pixels.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Alignment of the grid cell contents

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Name of query associated with grid control.

parameter.name: insert
parameter.help: User can insert row data in grid. Takes effect only if selectmode="edit"

parameter.name: delete
parameter.help: User can delete row data from grid. Takes effect only if selectmode="edit"

parameter.name: sort
parameter.help:
The sort button performs simple text sort on column. User can sort columns by clicking column head or by clicking sort buttons. Not valid with selectmode=browse.
Yes: sort buttons display on grid control

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font of data in column.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Size of text in column.

parameter.name: italic
parameter.help: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

parameter.name: bold
parameter.help: Yes: displays grid control text in bold

parameter.name: textcolor
parameter.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: href
parameter.help: URL or query column name that contains a URL to hyperlink each grid column with.

parameter.name: hrefkey
parameter.help: The query column to use for the value appended to the href URL of each column, instead of the column's value.

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: Frame in which to open link specified in href.

parameter.name: appendkey
parameter.help: When used with href, passes CFTREEITEMKEY variable with the value of the selected tree item in URL to the application page specified in the cfform action attribute

parameter.name: highlighthref
parameter.help: Yes: Highlights links that are associated with a cftreeitem with a URL attribute value. No: Disables highlight.

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: JavaScript function to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object value are passed to the specified routine, which should return True if validation succeeds; False, otherwise.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

parameter.name: griddataalign
parameter.help: Left: left-aligns data within column. Right: right-aligns data within column. Center: center-aligns data within column.

parameter.name: gridlines
parameter.help: Yes: enables row and column rules in grid control

parameter.name: rowheight
parameter.help: Minimum row height, in pixels, of grid control. Used with cfgridcolumn type = "Image"; defines space for graphics to display in row.

parameter.name: rowheaders
parameter.help: Yes: displays a column of numeric row labels in grid control

parameter.name: rowheaderalign
parameter.help: Left: left-aligns data within row header Right: right-aligns data within row header Center: center-aligns data within row header

parameter.name: rowheaderfont
parameter.help: Font of data in column.

parameter.name: rowheaderfontsize
parameter.help: Size of text in column.

parameter.name: rowheaderitalic
parameter.help: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

parameter.name: rowheaderbold
parameter.help: Yes: displays grid control text in bold

parameter.name: rowheadertextcolor
parameter.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: colheaders
parameter.help: Yes: displays a column of numeric row labels in grid control

parameter.name: colheaderalign
parameter.help: Left: left-aligns data within row header Right: right-aligns data within row header Center: center-aligns data within row header

parameter.name: colheaderfont
parameter.help: Font of data in column.

parameter.name: colheaderfontsize
parameter.help: Size of text in column.

parameter.name: colheaderitalic
parameter.help: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

parameter.name: colheaderbold
parameter.help: Yes: displays grid control text in bold

parameter.name: colheadertextcolor
parameter.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: Background color of grid control.

parameter.name: selectcolor
parameter.help: Background color for a selected item.

parameter.name: selectmode
parameter.help: Selection mode for items in the control. - Edit: user can edit grid data. Selecting a cell opens the editor for the cell type. - Row: user selections automatically extend to the row that contains selected cell. - Single: user selections are limited to selected cell. (Applet only) - Column: user selections automatically extend to column that contains selected cell. (Applet only) - Browse: user can only browse grid data. (Applet only)

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows to display in grid.

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help:
Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled. Default: "Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!"

values.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

parameter.name: picturebar
parameter.help: Yes: images for Insert, Delete, Sort buttons

parameter.name: insertbutton
parameter.help: Text for the insert button. Takes effect only if selectmode="edit".

parameter.name: deletebutton
parameter.help: Text of Delete button text. Takes effect only if selectmode="edit".

parameter.name: sortascendingbutton
parameter.help: Sort button text

parameter.name: sortdescendingbutton
parameter.help: Sort button text

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: Flash only: Must be a style specification in CSS format. Ignored for type="text".

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the control is enabled. A disabled control appears in light gray. Default: true

parameter.name: visible
parameter.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.help: Flash only: text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.

parameter.name: onchange
parameter.help: Flash only: ActionScript to run when the control changes due to user action in the control.

tag.name: cfgridcolumn
tag.help: Used with the cfgrid tag in a cfform. Use this tag to specify column data in a cfgrid control. The font and alignment attributes used in cfgridcolumn override global font or alignment settings defined in cfgrid.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of grid column element. If grid uses a query, column name must specify name of a query column.

parameter.name: header
parameter.help: Column header text. Used only if cfgrid colHeaders = "Yes".

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Column width, in pixels.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font of data in column.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Size of text in column.

parameter.name: italic
parameter.help: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

parameter.name: bold
parameter.help: Yes: displays grid control text in bold

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: Background color of control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: textcolor
parameter.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: href
parameter.help: URL o r query column name that contains a URL to hyperlink each grid column with.

parameter.name: hrefkey
parameter.help: The query column to use for the value appended to the href URL of each column, instead of the column's value.

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: Frame in which to open link specified in href.

parameter.name: select
parameter.help: Yes: user can select the column in grid control.

parameter.name: display
parameter.help: No: hides column

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: image: grid displays image that corresponds to value in column (a built-in CFML image name, or an image in cfide\classes directory or subdirectory referenced with relative URL). If image is larger than column cell, it is clipped to fit. Built-in image names

parameter.name: headerfont
parameter.help: Font of data in column.

parameter.name: headerfontsize
parameter.help: Size of text in column.

parameter.name: headeritalic
parameter.help: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

parameter.name: headerbold
parameter.help: Yes: displays grid control text in bold

parameter.name: headertextcolor
parameter.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: dataalign
parameter.help: Column data alignment

parameter.name: headeralign
parameter.help: Column header text alignment

parameter.name: numberformat
parameter.help: Format for displaying numeric data in grid. See numberFormat mask characters.

parameter.name: values
parameter.help: Formats cells in column as drop-down list boxes; specify items in drop-down list. Example: values = "arthur, scott, charles, 1-20, mabel"

parameter.name: valuesdisplay
parameter.help: Maps elements in values attribute to string to display in drop-down list. Delimited strings and/or numeric range(s).

parameter.name: valuesdelimiter
parameter.help: Maps elements in values attribute to string to display in drop-down list. Delimited strings and/or numeric range(s).

parameter.name: mask
parameter.help: A mask pattern that controls the character pattern that the form displays or allows users to input and sends to ColdFusion. For currency type data, use currency symbol. For text or numeric type data use: - A = [A-Za-z] - X = [A-Za-z0-9] - 9 = [0-9] - ? = Any character - all other = the literal character For date type data use datetime masks.

tag.name: cfgridrow
tag.help: Lets you define a cfgrid that does not use a query as source for row data. If a query attribute is specified in cfgrid, the cfgridrow tags are ignored.

parameter.name: data
parameter.help: Delimited list of column values. If a value contains a comma, it must be escaped with another comma

tag.name: cfgridupdate
tag.help:
Used within a cfgrid tag. Updates data sources directly from edited grid data. This tag provides a direct interface with your data source.
This tag applies delete row actions first, then insert row actions, then update row actions. If it encounters an error, it stops processing rows.

parameter.name: grid
parameter.help: Name of cfgrid form element that is the source for the update action.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: Name of data source for the update action.

parameter.name: tablename
parameter.help:
Table in which to insert form fields.
ORACLE drivers: must be uppercase. Sybase driver: case-sensitive. Must be the same case used when table was created

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Overrides username specified in ODBC setup.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Overrides password specified in ODBC setup.

parameter.name: tableowner
parameter.help: Table owner, if supported.

parameter.name: tablequalifier
parameter.help: For data sources that support table qualifiers, use this field to specify qualifier for table. The purpose of table qualifiers varies among drivers. For SQL Server and Oracle, qualifier refers to name of database that contains table. For Intersolv dBASE driver, qualifier refers to directory where DBF files are located.

parameter.name: keyonly
parameter.help: Applies to the update action: Yes: the WHERE criteria are limited to the key values No: the WHERE criteria include key values and the original values of changed fields

tag.name: cfheader
tag.help: Generates custom HTTP response headers to return to the client.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Header name Required if statusCode not specified

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: HTTP header value

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help:
The character encoding in which to encode the header value.
For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.

parameter.name: statuscode
parameter.help: HTTP status code Required if name not specified

parameter.name: statustext
parameter.help: Explains status code

tag.name: cfhtmlhead
tag.help: Writes text to the head section of a generated HTML page. It is useful for embedding JavaScript code, or putting other HTML tags, such as meta, link, title, or base in an HTML page header.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: Text to add to the <head> area of an HTML page.

tag.name: cfhttp
tag.help: Generates an HTTP request and handles the response from the server.

parameter.name: url
parameter.help:
Address of the resource on the server which will handle the request. The URL must include the hostname or IP address.
If you do not specify the transaction protocol (http:// or https://), CFML defaults to http.
If you specify a port number in this attribute, it overrides any port attribute value.
The cfhttppparam tag URL attribute appends query string attribute-value pairs to the URL.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Port number on the server to which to send the request. A port value in the url attribute overrides this value. (default: http 80 - https 443)

parameter.name: method
parameter.help: * GET Requests information from the server. Any data that the server requires to identify the requested information must be in the URL or in cfhttp type="URL" tags. * POST Sends information to the server for processing. Requires one or more cfhttpparam tags. Often used for submitting form-like data. * PUT Requests the server to store the message body at the specified URL. Use this method to send files to the server. * DELETE Requests the server to delete the specified URL. * HEAD Identical to the GET method, but the server does not send a message body in the response. Use this method for testing hypertext links for validity and accessibility, determining the type or modification time of a document, or determining the type of server. * TRACE Requests that the server echo the received HTTP headers back to the sender in the response body. Trace requests cannot have bodies. This method enables the CFML application to see what is being received at the server, and use that data for testing or diagnostic information. * OPTIONS A request for information about the communication options available for the server or the specified URL. This method enables the CFML application to determine the options and requirements associated with a URL, or the capabilities of a server, without requesting any additional activity by the server.

parameter.name: proxyserver
parameter.help: The proxy server required to access the URL.

parameter.name: proxyport
parameter.help: The port to use on The proxy server.

parameter.name: proxyuser
parameter.help: The user ID to send to the proxy server.

parameter.name: proxypassword
parameter.help: The user's password on the proxy server.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: A username. May be required by server.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: A password. May be required by server

parameter.name: useragent
parameter.help: Text to put in the user agent request header. Used to identify the request client software. Can make the CFML application appear to be a browser.

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help:
TThe character encoding of the request, including the URL query string and form or file data, and the response.
For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.

parameter.name: resolveurl
parameter.help: No does not resolve URLs in the response body. As a result, any relative URL links in the response body do not work. Yes resolves URLs in the response body to absolute URLs, including the port number, so that links in a retrieved page remain functional.

parameter.name: throwonerror
parameter.help: Yes if the server returns an error response code, throws an exception that can be caught using the cftry and cfcatch or CFML error pages. No does not throw an exception if an error response is returned. In this case, your application can use the cfhttp.StatusCode variable to determine if there was an error and its cause.

parameter.name: redirect
parameter.help: If the response header includes a Location field, determines whether to redirect execution to the URL specified in the field.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Value, in seconds of the maximum time the request can take. If the timeout passes without a response, CFML considers the request to have failed.

parameter.name: getasbinary
parameter.help: * No If CFML does not recognize the response body type as text, convert it to a CFML object. * Auto If CFML does not recognize the response body type as text, convert it to CFML Binary type data. * Yes Always convert the response body content into CFML Binary type data, even if CFML recognizes the response body type as text.

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: Specifies the name of the variable in which you want the result returned. Default: CFHTTP

parameter.name: delimiter
parameter.help: Sepcifies a character that separates quiery columns.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Tells ColdFusion to create a query object with the given name from the returned HTTP response body.

parameter.name: columns
parameter.help:
The column names for the query, separated by commas, with no spaces. Column names must start with a letter. The remaining characters can be letters, numbers, or underscore characters (_).
If there are no column name headers in the response, specify this attribute to identify the column names.
If you specify this attribute, and the firstrowasHeader attribute is True (the default), the column names specified by this attribute replace the first line of the response. You can use this behavior to replace the column names retrieved by the request with your own names.
If a duplicate column heading is encountered in either this attribute or in the column names from the response, ColdFusion appends an underscore to the name to make it unique.
If the number of columns specified by this attribute does not equal the number of columns in the HTTP response body, ColdFusion generates an error.

parameter.name: firstrowasheaders
parameter.help: Determines how ColdFusion processes the first row of the query record set: * yes: processes the first row as column heads. If you specify a columns attribute, ColdFusion ignores the first row of the file. * no: processes the first row as data. If you do not specify a columns attribute, ColdFusion generates column names by appending numbers to the word "column"; for example, "column_1".

parameter.name: delimiter
parameter.help: A character that separates query columns. The response body must use this character to separate the query columns.

parameter.name: textqualifier
parameter.help:
A character that, optionally, specifies the start and end of a text column. This character must surround any text fields in the response body that contain the delimiter character as part of the field value.
To include this character in column text, escape it by using two characters in place of one. For example, if the qualifier is a double-quotation mark, escape it as "".

tag.name: cfhttpparam
tag.help: Allowed inside cfhttp tag bodies only. Required for cfhttp POST operations. Optional for all others. Specifies parameters to build an HTTP request.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Information type * Header: The parameter specifies an HTTP header. (ColdFusion does not URL encode the header) * Body: Specifies the body of the HTTP request. (ColdFusion does not URL encode the body contents) * XML: Identifies the request as having a content-type of text/xml. Specifies that the value attribute contains the body of the HTTP request. Used to send XML to the destination URL. CFML does not URL encode the XML data. * CGI: Specifies an HTTP header. CFML URL encodes the header by default. * File: Tells CFML to send the contents of the specified file. CFML does not URL encode the file contents * URL: Specifies a URL query string name-value pair to append to the cfhttp url attribute. CFML URL encodes the query string. * FormField: Specifies a form field to send. CFML URL encodes the Form field by default. * Cookie: Specifies a cookie to send as an HTTP header. CFML URL encodes the cookie.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Variable name for data that is passed. Ignored for Body and XML types. For File type, specifies the filename to send in the request.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value of the data that is sent. Ignored for File type. The value must contain string data or data that CFML can convert to a string for all type attributes except Body. Body types can have string or binary values.

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: Applies to File type; ignored for all other types. The absolute path to the file that is sent in the request body.

parameter.name: encoded
