parameter.help: Applies to FormField and CGI types; ignored for all other types. Specifies whether to URLEncode the form field or header.

parameter.name: mimetype
parameter.help: Applies to File type; invalid for all other types. Specifies the MIME media type of the file contents. The content type can include an identifier for the character encoding of the file; for example, text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1 indicates that the file is HTML text in the ISO Latin-1 character encoding.

tag.name: cfif
tag.help: Creates simple and compound conditional statements in CFML. Tests an expression, variable, function return value, or string. Used, optionally, with the cfelse and cfelseif tags.

tag.name: cfimport
tag.help:
You can use the cfimport tag to import either of the following:
* All CFML pages in a directory, as a tag custom tag library. * A Java Server Page (JSP) tag library. A JSP tag library is a packaged set of tag handlers that conform to the JSP 1.1 tag extension API.

parameter.name: taglib
parameter.help:
Tag library URI. The path must be relative to the web root (and start with /), the current page location, or a directory specified in the Administrator CFML mappings page.
A directory in which custom CFML tags are stored. In this case, all the cfm pages in this directory are treated as custom tags in a tag library. A path to a JAR in a web-application; for example, "/WEB-INF/lib/sometags.jar" A path to a tag library descriptor; for example, "/sometags.tld" Note: You must put JSP custom tag libraries in the /WEB-IN/lib directory. This limitation does not apply to CFML pages.

parameter.name: prefix
parameter.help:
Prefix by which to access the imported custom CFML tags JSP tags.
If you import a CFML custom tag directory and specify an empty value, "", for this attribute, you can call the custom tags without using a prefix. You must specify and use a prefix for a JSP tag library.

tag.name: cfinclude
tag.help: Embeds references to CFML pages in CFML. You can embed cfinclude tags recursively. For another way to encapsulate CFML, see cfmodule. (A CFML page was formerly sometimes called a CFML template or a template.)

parameter.name: template
parameter.help: A logical path to a CFML page.

tag.name: cfindex
tag.help:
Populates a Verity search engine collection with an index of documents on a file system or of CFML query result sets.
A collection must exist before it can be populated.

parameter.name: collection
parameter.help: Name of a collection that is registered by CFML; for example, "personnel" Name and absolute path of a collection that is not registered by CFML; for example: "e:\collections\personnel"

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: - update: updates a collection and adds key to the index. - delete: removes collection documents as specified by the key attribute. - purge: deletes all of the documents in a collection. Causes the collection to be taken offline, preventing searches. - refresh: deletes all of the documents in a collection, and then performs an update.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: file: using the key attribute value of the query result as input, applies action value to filenames or filepaths. path: using the key attribute value of the query result as input, applies action to filenames or filepaths that pass the extensions filter custom: If action = "update" or "delete": applies action to custom entities in query results.

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: * Title for collection * Query column name for type and a valid query name Permits searching collections by title or displaying a separate title from the key

parameter.name: key
parameter.help:
* Absolute path and filename, if type = "file" * Absolute path, if type = "path" * A query column name (typically, the primary key column name), if type = "custom" * A query column name, if type = any other value
This attribute is required for the actions listed, unless you intend for its value to be an empty string.

parameter.name: body
parameter.help:
* ASCII text to index * Query column name(s), if name is specified in query
You can specify columns in a delimited list. For example: "emp_name, dept_name, location"

parameter.name: custom1
parameter.help: Custom field in which you can store data during an indexing operation. Specify a query column name for type, and a query name.

parameter.name: custom2
parameter.help: Custom field in which you can store data during an indexing operation. Specify a query column name for type, and a query name.

parameter.name: custom3
parameter.help: Custom field in which you can store data during an indexing operation. Specify a query column name for type, and a query name. (Added in ColdFusion 7)

parameter.name: custom4
parameter.help: Custom field in which you can store data during an indexing operation. Specify a query column name for type, and a query name. (Added in ColdFusion 7)

parameter.name: category
parameter.help: A string value that specifies one or more search categories for which to index the data. You can define multiple categories, separated by commas, for a single index.

parameter.name: categoryTree
parameter.help: A string value that specifies a hierarchical category or category tree for searching. It is a series of categories separated by forward slashes ("/"). You can specify only one category tree.

parameter.name: urlpath
parameter.help: If type="file" or "path", specifies the URL path. When the collection is searched with cfsearch, this pathname is prefixed to filenames and returned as the url attribute.

parameter.name: extensions
parameter.help:
Delimited list of file extensions that CFML uses to index files, if type = "Path". "*." returns files with no extension.
For example: the following code returns files with a listed extension or no extension: extensions = ".htm, .html, .cfm, .cfml, "*."

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Query against which collection is generated

parameter.name: recurse
parameter.help: Yes: if type = "path", directories below the path specified in key are included in indexing operation

parameter.name: language
parameter.help: For options, see cfcollection. Requires the appropriate Verity Locales language pack (Western Europe, Asia, Multilanguage, Eastern Europe/Middle Eastern).

parameter.name: status
parameter.help: The name of the structure into which ColdFusion MX returns status information.

tag.name: cfinput
tag.help: Used within the cfform tag, to place radio buttons, check boxes, or text boxes on a form. Provides input validation for the specified control type.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for form input element.

parameter.name: autosuggest
parameter.help: Specifies entry completion suggestions to display as the user types into a text input. The user can select a suggestion to complete the text entry. The valid value can be either of the following: • A string consisting of the suggestion values separated by the delimiter specified by the delimiter attribute. • A bind expression that gets the suggestion values based on the current input text. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

parameter.name: autosuggestbinddelay
parameter.help: The minimum time between autosuggest bind expression invocations, in seconds. Use this attribute to limit the number of requests that are sent to the server when a user types. Valid only for cfinput type="text"

parameter.name: autosuggestminlength
parameter.help: The minimum number of characters required in the text box before invoking a bind expression to return items for suggestion. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

parameter.name: bindattribute
parameter.help: Specifies the HTML tag attribute whose value is set by the bind attribute. You can only specify attributes in the browser’s HTML DOM tree, not ColdFusion-specific attributes. Ignored if there is no bind attribute. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

parameter.name: bindonload
parameter.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to execute the bind attribute expression when first loading the form. Ignored if there is no bind attribute. Valid only for cfinput type="text".

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: ID for form input element.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The input control type to create: - button: push button. - checkbox: check box. - file: file selector; not supported in Flash. - hidden: invisible control. - image: clickable button with an image. - password: password entry control; hides input values. - radio: radio button. - reset: form reset button. - submit: form submission button. - text: text entry box. - datefield: Flash only; date entry field with an expanding calendar for selecting dates.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: Label to put next to the control on a Flash or XML form. Not used for button, hidden, image, reset, or submit types.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: In HTML or XML format, ColdFusion passes the style attribute to the browser or XML. In Flash format, must be a style specification in CSS format.

parameter.name: class
parameter.help: Stylesheet class for form input element.

parameter.name: mask
parameter.help: A mask pattern that controls the character pattern that users can enter, or that the form sends to ColdFusion. In HTML and Flash for type=text use: - A = [A-Za-z] - X = [A-Za-z0-9] - 9 = [0-9] - ? = Any character - all other = the literal character In Flash for type=datefield use: - D = day; can use 0-2 mask characters. - M = month; can use 0-4 mask characters. - Y = year; can use 0, 2, or 4 characters. - E = day in week; can use 0-4 characters.

parameter.name: validate
parameter.help: date: verifies format mm/dd/yy. eurodate: verifies date format dd/mm/yyyy. time: verifies time format hh:mm:ss. float: verifies floating point format. integer: verifies integer format. telephone: verifies telephone format ###-###-####. The separator can be a blank. Area code and exchange must begin with digit 1 - 9. zipcode: verifies, in U.S. formats only, 5- or 9-digit format #####-####. The separator can be a blank. creditcard: strips blanks and dashes; verifies number using mod10 algorithm. Number must have 13-16 digits. social_security_number: verifies format ###-##-####. The separator can be a blank. regular_expression: matches input against pattern attribute.

parameter.name: validateat
parameter.help: How to do the validation; one or more of the following: onSubmit, onServer or onBlur. onBlur and onSubmit are identical in Flash forms. For multiple values, use a comma-delimited list. Default: onSubmit

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message text to display if validation fails

parameter.name: range
parameter.help: Minimum and maximum value range, separated by a comma. If type = "text" or "password", this applies only to numeric data.

parameter.name: maxlength
parameter.help: Maximum length of text entered, if type=text or password.

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.help: JavaScript regular expression pattern to validate input. ColdFusion uses this attribute only if you specify regex in the validate attribute. Omit leading and trailing slashes.

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object values are passed to the routine, which should return True if validation succeeds, and False otherwise. If used, the validate attribute is ignored.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: Size of input control. Ignored, if type=radio or checkbox. If specified in a Flash form, ColdFusion sets the control width pixel value to 10 times the specified size and ignores the width attribute.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: HTML: corresponds to the HTML value attribute. Its use depends on control type. Flash: optional; specifies text for button type inputs: button, submit, and image.

parameter.name: bind
parameter.help: A Flash bind expression that populates the field with information from other form fields.

parameter.name: checked
parameter.help: Selects a control. No value is required. Applies if type=radio or checkbox. Default: false

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.help: Disables user input, making the control read-only. To disable input, specify disabled without an attribute or disabled="true". To enable input, omit the attribute or specify disabled="false".

parameter.name: src
parameter.help: Applies to Flash button, reset, submit, and image types, and the HTML image type. URL of an image to use on the button. Flash does not support GIF images.

parameter.name: onkeyup
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a keyboard key in the control.

parameter.name: onkeydown
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) ActionScript to run when the user presses a keyboard key in the control.

parameter.name: onmouseup
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user presses a mouse button in the control.

parameter.name: onmousedown
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a mouse button in the control.

parameter.name: onchange
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the control changes due to user action. In Flash, applies to datefield, password, and text types only.

parameter.name: onclick
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user clicks the control. In Flash, applies to button, checkbox, image, radio, reset, and submit types only.

parameter.name: daynames
parameter.help: A comma-delimited list that sets the names of the weekdays displayed in the calendar. Sunday is the first day and the rest of the weekday names follow in the normal order. Default is: S,M,T,W,Th,F,S

parameter.name: firstdayofweek
parameter.help: Integer in the range 0-6 specifying the first day of the week in the calendar, 0 indicates Sunday, 6 indicates Saturday. Default is: 0

parameter.name: monthnames
parameter.help: A comma-delimited list of the month names that are displayed at the top of the calendar.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the control is enabled. A disabled control appears in light gray. The inverse of the disabled attribute. Flash only. Default: true

parameter.name: visible
parameter.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Applies to most Flash types, HTML image type on some browsers. The width of the control, in pixels. For Flash forms, ColdFusion ignores this attribute if you also specify a size attribute value.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Applies to most Flash types, HTML image type on some browsers. The height of the control, in pixels. The displayed height might be less than the specified size.

parameter.name: passthrough
parameter.help:
This attribute is deprecated.
Passes arbitrary attribute-value pairs to the HTML code that is generated for the tag. You can use either of the following formats:
passthrough="title=""myTitle""" passthrough='title="mytitle"'

tag.name: cfinsert
tag.help: Inserts records in data sources from data in a CFML form or form Scope.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: Data source; contains table.

parameter.name: tablename
parameter.help:
Table in which to insert form fields.
ORACLE drivers: must be uppercase. Sybase driver: case-sensitive. Must be the same case used when table was created

parameter.name: tableowner
parameter.help: For data sources that support table ownership (such as SQL Server, Oracle, and Sybase SQL Anywhere), use this field to specify the owner of the table.

parameter.name: tablequalifier
parameter.help: For data sources that support table qualifiers, use this field to specify qualifier for table. The purpose of table qualifiers varies among drivers. For SQL Server and Oracle, qualifier refers to name of database that contains table. For Intersolv dBASE driver, qualifier refers to directory where DBF files are located.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Overrides username specified in ODBC setup.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Overrides password specified in ODBC setup.

parameter.name: formfields
parameter.help:
Comma-delimited list of form fields to insert. If not specified, all fields in the form are included.
If a form field is not matched by a column name in the database, CFML throws an error.
The database table key field must be present in the form. It may be hidden.

tag.name: cfinvoke
tag.help:
Does either of the following:
* Invokes a component method from within a CFML page or component. * Invokes a web service. Different attribute combonations make some attributes required at sometimes and not at others.

parameter.name: component
parameter.help: String or component object; a reference to a component, or component to instantiate.

parameter.name: method
parameter.help: Name of a method. For a web service, the name of an operation.

parameter.name: returnvariable
parameter.help: Name of a variable for the invocation result.

parameter.name: argumentcollection
parameter.help: Name of a structure; associative array of arguments to pass to the method.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Overrides username specified in Administrator > Web Services

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Overrides passowrd specified in Administrator > Web Services

parameter.name: webservice
parameter.help: The URL of the WSDL file for the web service.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: The timeout for the web service request, in seconds

parameter.name: proxyserver
parameter.help: The proxy server required to access the webservice URL.

parameter.name: proxyport
parameter.help: The port to use on The proxy server.

parameter.name: proxyuser
parameter.help: The user ID to send to the proxy server.

parameter.name: proxypassword
parameter.help: The user's password on the proxy server.

parameter.name: serviceport
parameter.help: The port name for the web service. This value is case-sensitive and corresponds to the port element's name attribute under the service element. Specify this attribute if the web service contains multiple ports. Default: first port found in the WSDL.

tag.name: cfinvokeargument
tag.help: Passes the name and value of a parameter to a component method or a web service. This tag is used within the cfinvoke tag.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Argument name

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Argument value

parameter.name: omit
parameter.help: Enables you to omit a parameter when invoking a web service. It is an error to specify omit="true" if the cfinvoke webservice attribute is not specified. - true: omit this parameter when invoking a web service. - false: do not omit this parameter when invoking a web service.

tag.name: cflayout
tag.help: Creates a region of its container (such as the browser window or a cflayoutarea tag) with a specific layout behavior: a bordered area, a horizontal or vertically arranged box, or a tabbed navigator.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The type of layout.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Specifies the default alignment of the content of child layout areas. Each cflayoutarea tag can specify an alignment attribute to override this value.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the layout region. Must be unique on a page.

parameter.name: padding
parameter.help: Applies only to hbox and vbox layouts. You can use any valid CSS length or percent format, such as 10, 10% 10px, or 10em, for this attribute. The padding is included in the child layout area and takes the style of the layout area.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: A CSS style specification that defines layout styles.

tag.name: cflayoutarea
tag.help: Defines a region within a cflayout tag body, such as an individual tab of a tabbed layout. This tag is not used in Flash forms.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: The position...(docs don't explain this one).

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Specifies how to align child controls within the layout area.

parameter.name: closable
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the area can close. Specifying this attribute adds an x icon on the tab or title bar that a user can click to close the area. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.

parameter.name: collapsible
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the area can collapse. Specifying this attribute adds a >> or << icon on the title bar that a user can click to collapse the area. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.

parameter.name: direction
parameter.help: The position of the area in the layout. Border style layouts can have at most one layout area of each type.

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the tab is disabled, that is, whether user can select the tab to display its contents. Disabled tabs are greyed out. Ignored if the selected attribute value is true.

parameter.name: initCollapsed
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the area is initially collapsed. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center. Ignored if the collapsible attribute value is false.

parameter.name: initHide
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the area is initially hidden. To show an initially hidden area, use the ColdFusion.Layout.showArea or ColdFusion.Layout.showTab function. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.

parameter.name: maxSize
parameter.help: For layouts with top or bottom position attributes, the maximum height of the area, in pixels, that you can set by dragging a splitter. For layouts with left or right position attributes, the maximum width of the area. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.

parameter.name: minSize
parameter.help: For layouts with top or bottom position attributes, the minimum height of the area, in pixels, that you can set by dragging a splitter. For layouts with left or right position attributes, the minimum width of the area., You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the layout area.

parameter.name: onBindError
parameter.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message. If you omit this attribute, and have specified a global error handler (by using the ColdFusion.setGlobalErrorHandlerfunction ), it displays the error message; otherwise a default error pop-up displays.

parameter.name: overflow
parameter.help: Specifies how to display child content whose size would cause the control to overflow the window boundaries. � In Internet Explorer, layout areas with the visible setting expand to fit the size of the contents, rather than having the contents extend beyond the layout area.

parameter.name: selected
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether this tab is initially selected so that its contents appears in the layout.

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: For hbox layouts and border layouts with top or bottom position attributes, the initial height of the area. For vbox layouts and border layouts with left or right position attributes, the initial width of the area. For hbox and vbox layouts, you can use any valid CSS length or percent format (such as 10, 10% 10px, or 10em) for this attribute. For border layouts, this attribute value must be an integer number of pixels. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center. ColdFusion automatically determines the center size based on the size of all other layout areas.

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: A URL that returns the layout area contents. ColdFusion uses standard page path resolution rules. You can use a bind expression with dependencies in this attribute. If file specified in this attribute includes tags that use AJAX features, such as cfform, cfgrid, and cfpod, you must use the cfajaximport tag on the page that includes the cflayoutarea tag. For more information, see cfajaximport.

parameter.name: splitter
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the layout area has a divider between it and the adjacent layoutarea control. Users can drag the splitter to change the relative sizes of the areas. If this attribute is set true on a left or right position layout area, the splitter resizes the area and its adjacent area horizontally. If this attribute is set true on a top or bottom position layout area, the splitter resizes the layout vertically. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: A CSS style specification that controls the appearance of the area.

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: For tab layouts, the text to display on the tab. For border layouts, if you specify this attribute ColdFusion creates a title bar for the layout area with the specified text as the title. By default, these layouts do not have a title bar if they are not closable or collapsible. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.

tag.name: cfldap
tag.help: Provides an interface to a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) directory server, such as the Netscape Directory Server.

parameter.name: server
parameter.help: Host name or IP address of LDAP server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Port of the LDAP server (default 389).

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: The User ID. Required if secure = "CFSSL_BASIC"

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Password that corresponds to user name. If secure = "CFSSL_BASIC", V2 encrypts the password before transmission.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: * query: returns LDAP entry information only. Requires name, start, and attributes attributes. * add: adds LDAP entries to LDAP server. Requires attributes attribute. * modify: modifies LDAP entries, except distinguished name dn attribute, on LDAP server. Requires dn. See modifyType attribute. * modifyDN: modifies distinguished name attribute for LDAP entries on LDAP server. Requires dn. * delete: deletes LDAP entries on an LDAP server. Requires dn.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Required if action = "Query" Name of LDAP query. The tag validates the value.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Maximum length of time, in seconds, to wait for LDAP processing. Default 60000

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of entries for LDAP queries.

parameter.name: start
parameter.help: Required if action = "Query" Distinguished name of entry to be used to start a search.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.help: Scope of search, from entry specified in start attribute for action = "Query". * oneLevel: entries one level below entry. * base: only the entry. * subtree: entry and all levels below it.

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.help:
Required if action = "Query", "Add", "ModifyDN", or "Modify" For queries: comma-delimited list of attributes to return. For queries, to get all attributes, specify "*".
If action = "add" or "modify", you can specify a list of update columns. Separate attributes with a semicolon.
If action = "ModifyDN", CFML passes attributes to the LDAP server without syntax checking.

parameter.name: returnasbinary
parameter.help: A comma-delimited list of columns that are to be returned as binary values.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.help: Search criteria for action = "Query". List attributes in the form: "(attribute operator value)" Example: "(sn = Smith)"

parameter.name: sort
parameter.help: Attribute(s) by which to sort query results. Use a comma delimiter.

parameter.name: sortcontrol
parameter.help:
Default asc * nocase: case-insensitive sort * asc: ascending (a to z) case-sensitive sort * desc: descending (z to a) case-sensitive sort
You can enter a combination of sort types; for example, sortControl = "nocase, asc".

parameter.name: dn
parameter.help: Distinguished name, for update action. Example: "cn = Bob Jensen, o = Ace Industry, c = US"

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: Used with action = "query". First row of LDAP query to insert into a CFML query.

parameter.name: modifytype
parameter.help:
Default replace
How to process an attribute in a multi-value list. * add: appends it to any attributes * delete: deletes it from the set of attributes * replace: replaces it with specified attributes
You cannot add an attribute that is already present or that is empty.

parameter.name: rebind
parameter.help: * Yes: attempt to rebind referral callback and reissue query by referred address using original credentials. * No: referred connections are anonymous

parameter.name: referral
parameter.help: Number of hops allowed in a referral. A value of 0 disables referred addresses for LDAP; no data is returned.

parameter.name: secure
parameter.help:
Security to employ, and required information. One option: * CFSSL_BASIC
"CFSSL_BASIC" provides V2 SSL encryption and server authentication.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.help:
Default , (a comma) Delimiter to separate attribute values of multi-value attributes. Used by query, add, and modify actions, and by cfldap to output multi-value attributes.
For example, if $ (dollar sign), the attributes attribute could be "objectclass = top$person", where the first value of objectclass is top, and the second value is person. This avoids confusion if values include commas.

parameter.name: delimiter
parameter.help:
Separator between attribute name-value pairs. Use this attribute if:
* the attributes attribute specifies more than one item, or * an attribute contains the default delimiter (semicolon). For example: mgrpmsgrejecttext;lang-en
Used by query, add, and modify actions, and by cfldap to output multi-value attributes.
For example, if $ (dollar sign), you could specify "cn = Double Tree Inn$street = 1111 Elm; Suite 100 where the semicolon is part of the street value.

tag.name: cflocation
tag.help: Stops execution of the current page and opens a CFML page or HTML file.

parameter.name: url
parameter.help: URL of HTML file or CFML page to open.

parameter.name: addtoken
parameter.help: clientManagement must be enabled (see cfapplication).

tag.name: cflock
tag.help:
Ensures the integrity of shared data. Instantiates the following kinds of locks:
* Exclusive allows single-thread access to the CFML constructs * Read-only allows multiple requests to access CFML constructs

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Maximum length of time, in seconds, to wait to obtain a lock. If lock is obtained, tag execution continues. Otherwise, behavior depends on throwOnTimeout attribute value.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.help: Lock scope. Mutually exclusive with the name attribute. Lock name. Only one request in the specified scope can execute the code within this tag (or within any other cflock tag with the same lock scope scope) at a time.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Lock name. Mutually exclusive with the scope attribute. Only one request can execute the code within a cflock tag with a given name at a time. Cannot be an empty string.

parameter.name: throwontimeout
parameter.help: How timeout conditions are handled.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: readOnly: lets more than one request read shared data. exclusive: lets one request read or write shared data.

tag.name: cflog
tag.help: Writes a message to a log file.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: Message text to log.

parameter.name: log
parameter.help:
If you omit the file attribute, writes messages to standard log file. Ignored, if you specify file attribute.
Application: writes to Application.log, normally used for application-specific messages. Scheduler: writes to Scheduler.log, normally used to log the execution of scheduled tasks.

parameter.name: file
parameter.help:
Message file. Specify only the main part of the filename. For example, to log to the Testing.log file, specify "Testing".
The file must be located in the default log directory. You cannot specify a directory path. If the file does not exist, it is created automatically, with the suffix .log.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Type (severity) of the message

parameter.name: application
parameter.help: log application name, if it is specified in a cfapplication tag.

tag.name: cflogin
tag.help: A container for user login and authentication code. CFML runs the code in this tag if a user is not already logged in. You put code in the tag that authenticates the user and identifies the user with a set of roles. Used with cfloginuser tag.

parameter.name: idletimeout
parameter.help: Time interval with no keyboard activity after which CFML logs the user off. Seconds.

parameter.name: applicationtoken
parameter.help: Unique application identifier. Limits the login validity to one application, as specified by the cfapplication tag.

parameter.name: cookiedomain
parameter.help: Domain of the cookie that is used to mark a user as logged in. Use this attribute to enable a user login cookie to work with multiple clustered servers in the same domain.

tag.name: cfloginuser
tag.help: Identifies an authenticated user to CFML. Specifies the user ID and roles. Used within a cflogin tag.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A username.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: A user password.

parameter.name: roles
parameter.help:
A comma-delimited list of role identifiers.
CFML processes spaces in a list element as part of the element.

tag.name: cflogout
tag.help: Logs the current user out. Removes knowledge of the user ID, password, and roles from the server. If you do not use this tag, the user is automatically logged out when the session ends.

tag.name: cfloop
tag.help: Different items are required based on loop type. Items listed as required may not be depending on your loop type. Loop forms: [query] [condition] [index + from + to ] [index + list] [collection + item ]

parameter.name: index
parameter.help: Index value. CFML sets it to from value and increments or decrements by step value, until it equals to value.

parameter.name: to
parameter.help: Beginning value of index.

parameter.name: from
parameter.help: Ending value of index.

parameter.name: step
parameter.help: Ending value of index.

parameter.name: condition
parameter.help: Condition that controls the loop.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Query that controls the loop.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: First row of query that is included in the loop.

parameter.name: endrow
parameter.help: Last row of query that is included in the loop.

parameter.name: list
parameter.help: A list, variable, or filename; contains a list

parameter.name: delimiters
parameter.help: Character(s) that separates items in list

parameter.name: collection
parameter.help: The collection attribute is used with the item attribute. often to loop over a structure

parameter.name: array
parameter.help: An array.

parameter.name: item
parameter.help: The item attribute is used with the collection attribute. often to loop over a structure

tag.name: cfmail
tag.help: Sends an e-mail message that optionally contains query output, using an SMTP server.

parameter.name: to
parameter.help: Message recipient e-mail addresses.

parameter.name: from
parameter.help: E-mail message sender:

parameter.name: cc
parameter.help: Address(es) to which to copy the message

parameter.name: bcc
parameter.help: Address(es) to which to copy the message, without listing them in the message header.

parameter.name: subject
parameter.help: Message subject. Can be dynamically generated.

parameter.name: replyto
parameter.help: Address(es) to which the recipient is directed to send replies.

parameter.name: failto
parameter.help: Address to which mailing systems should send delivery failure notifications. Sets the mail envelope reverse-path value.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: A user name to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a password attribute

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: A password to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a username attribute.

parameter.name: wraptext
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum line length, in characters of the mail text. If a line has more than the specified number of characters, replaces the last white space character, such as a tab or space, preceding the specified position with a line break. If there are no white space characters, inserts a line break at the specified position. A common value for this attribute is 72.

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help:
The character encoding in which the part text is encoded.
For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The MIME media type of the part. Can be a can be valid MIME media type

parameter.name: mimeattach
parameter.help: Path of file to attach to message. Attached file is MIME-encoded. CFML attempts to determine the MIME type of the file; use the cfmailparam tag to send an attachement and specify the MIME type.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Name of cfquery from which to draw data for message(s). Use this attribute to send more than one message, or to send query results within a message.

parameter.name: group
parameter.help: Query column to use when you group sets of records to send as a message. For example, to send a set of billing statements to a customer, group on "Customer_ID." Case-sensitive. Eliminates adjacent duplicates when data is sorted by the specified field.

parameter.name: groupcasesensitive
parameter.help: Whether to consider case when using the group attribute. To group on case-sensitive records, set this attribute to Yes.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: Row in a query to start from.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of messages to send when looping over a query.

parameter.name: server
parameter.help: SMTP server address, or (Enterprise edition only) a comma-delimited list of server addresses, to use for sending messages. At least one server must be specified here or in the CFML MX Administrator. A value here overrides the Administrator. A value that includes a port specification overrides the port attribute. See the Usage section for details.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: TCP/IP port on which SMTP server listens for requests (normally 25). A value here overrides the Administrator.

parameter.name: mailerid
parameter.help: Mailer ID to be passed in X-Mailer SMTP header, which identifies the mailer application.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Number of seconds to wait before timing out connection to SMTP server. A value here overrides the Administrator.

parameter.name: spoolenable
parameter.help: Specifies whether to spool mail or always send it Immediately. Overrides the CFML MX Administrator Spool mail messages to disk for delivery setting.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.help: * Yes: sends debugging output to standard output. By default, if the console window is unavailable, ColdFusion sends output to cf_root\runtime\logs\coldfusion-out.log on server configurations. On J2EE configurations, with JRun, the default location is jrun_home/logs/servername-out.log. * No: does not generate debugging output.

tag.name: cfmailparam
tag.help: Attaches a file or adds a header to an e-mail message. Can only be used in the cfmail tag. You can use more than one cfmailparam tag within a cfmail tag.

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: Attaches file to a message. Mutually exclusive with name attribute. The file is MIME encoded before sending.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The MIME media type of the part. Can be a can be valid MIME media type

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of header. Case-insensitive. Mutually exclusive with file attribute. The values listed are from rfc2822

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value of the header.

parameter.name: contentID
parameter.help: The Identifier for the attached file. This ID should be globally unique and is used to identify the file in an IMG or other tag in the mail body that references the file content.

parameter.name: disposition
parameter.help: How the attached file is to be handled. Can be one of the following: - attachment: present the file as an attachment - inline: display the file contents in the message

tag.name: cfmailpart
tag.help: Specifies one part of a multipart e-mail message. Can only be used in the cfmail tag. You can use more than one cfmailpart tag within a cfmail tag.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The MIME media type of the part. Can be a can be valid MIME media type

parameter.name: wraptext
parameter.help: Specifies the maximum line length, in characters of the mail text. If a line has more than the specified number of characters, replaces the last white space character, such as a tab or space, preceding the specified position with a line break. If there are no white space characters, inserts a line break at the specified position. A common value for this attribute is 72.

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help:
The character encoding in which the part text is encoded.
For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.

tag.name: cfmodule
tag.help: Invokes a custom tag for use in CFML application pages. This tag processes custom tag name conflicts.

parameter.name: template
parameter.help:
Mutually exclusive with the name attribute. A path to the page that implements the tag.
Relative path: expanded from the current page Absolute path: expanded using CFML mapping A physical path is not valid.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help:
Mutually exclusive with the template attribute. A custom tag name, in the form "Name.Name.Name..." Identifies subdirectory, under the CFML tag root directory, that contains custom tag page. For example (Windows format):
<cfmodule name = "superduper.Forums40.GetUserOptions">
This identifies the page GetUserOptions.cfm in the directory CustomTags\superduper\Forums40 under the CFML root directory.

parameter.name: attributecollection
parameter.help: A collection of key-value pairs that represent attribute names and values. You can specify multiple key-value pairs. You can specify this attribute only once.

tag.name: cfntauthenticate
tag.help: Authenticates a user name and password against the NT domain on which ColdFusion server is running, and optionally retrieves the user's groups.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: User's login name.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: User's login name.

parameter.name: domain
parameter.help: Domain against which to authenticate the user. The ColdFusion J2EE server must be running on this domain.

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: Name of the variable in which to return the results. Default: cfntauthenticate

parameter.name: listgroups
parameter.help: Boolean value specifying whether to Include a comma-delimited list of the user's groups in the result structure. Default: false

parameter.name: throwonerror
parameter.help: Boolean value specifying whether to throw an exception if the validation fails. If this attribute is true, ColdFusion throws an error if the user name or password is invalid; the application must handle such errors in a try/catch block or ColdFusion error handler page. Default: false

tag.name: cfobject
tag.help:
Creates a CFML object, of a specified type.
The tag syntax depends on the object type. Some types use the type attribute; others do not.

tag.name: cfobjectcache
tag.help: Flushes the query cache.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: clear: Clears queries from the cache in the Application scope

tag.name: cfoutput
tag.help: Displays output that can contain the results of processing CFML variables and functions. Can loop over the results of a database query.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Name of cfquery from which to draw data for output section.

parameter.name: group
parameter.help: Query column to use to group sets of records. Eliminates adjacent duplicate rows when data is sorted. Use if you retrieved a record set ordered on one or more a query columns. For example, if a record set is ordered on "Customer_ID" in the cfquery tag, you can group the output on "Customer_ID."

parameter.name: groupcasesensitive
parameter.help: Whether to consider the case in grouping rows.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: Row from which to start output.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows to display.

tag.name: cfparam
tag.help: Tests for a parameter's existence, tests its data type, and, if a default value is not assigned, optionally provides one.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of parameter to test (such as "client.email" or "cookie.backgroundColor"). If omitted, and if the parameter does not exist, an error is thrown.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The valid format for the data; one of the following. * any: any type of value. * array: an array of values. * binary: a binary value. * boolean: a Boolean value: yes, no, true, false, or a number. * creditcard: a 13-16 digit number conforming to the mod10 algorithm. * date or time: a date-time value. * email: a valid e-mail address. * eurodate: a date-time value. Any date part must be in the format dd/mm/yy, The format can use /, -, or . characters as delimiters. * float or numeric: a numeric value. * guid: a Universally Unique Identifier of the form "XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX" where 'X' is a hexadecimal number. * numeric: a numeric value * integer: an integer. * query: a query object. * range: a numeric range, specified by the min and max attributes. * regex or regular_expression: matches input against pattern attribute. * ssn or social_security_number: a U.S. social security number. * string: a string value or single character. * struct: a structure. * telephone: a standard U.S. telephone number. * URL: an http, https, ftp, file, mailto, or news URL. * UUID: a ColdFusion Universally Unique Identifier, formatted 'XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXXXXX', where 'X' is a hexadecimal number. See CreateUUID. * USdate: a U.S. date of the format mm/dd/yy, with 1-2 digit days and months, 1-4 digit years. * variableName: a string formatted according to ColdFusion variable naming conventions. * xml: XML objects and XML strings. * zipcode: U.S., 5- or 9-digit format ZIP codes.

parameter.name: default
parameter.help: Value to set parameter to if it does not exist. Any expression used for the default attribute is evaluated, even if the parameter exists. The result is not assigned if the parameter exists, but if the expression has side effects, they still occur.

parameter.name: max
parameter.help: The maximum valid value; used only for range validation.

parameter.name: min
parameter.help: The minimum valid value; used only for range validation.

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.help: A regular experession that the parameter must match; used only for regex or regular_expression validation.

tag.name: cfpod
tag.help: Creates a pod, an area of the browser window or layout area with an optional title bar and body that contains display elements.

parameter.name: bodyStyle
parameter.help: A CSS style specification for the pod body. As a general rule, use this attribute to set color and font styles. Using this attribute to set the height and width, for example, can result in distorted output.

parameter.name: headerStyle
parameter.help: A CSS style specification for the pod header. As a general rule, use this attribute to set color and font styles. Using this attribute to set the height and width, for example, can result in distorted output.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Height if the control, including the title bar and borders, in pixels. Default is 100.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the pod control.

parameter.name: onBindError
parameter.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message. If you omit this attribute, and have specified a global error handler (by using the ColdFusion.setGlobalErrorHandler function), it displays the error message; otherwise a default error pop-up displays.

parameter.name: overflow
parameter.help: Specifies how to display child content whose size would cause the control to overflow the pod boundaries. Note: In Internet Explorer, pods with the visible setting expand to fit the size of the contents, rather than having the contents extend beyond the layout area.

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: A URL that returns the pod contents. ColdFusion uses standard page path resolution rules. If you specify this attribute and the cfpod tag has a body, ColdFusion ignores the body contents. You can use a a bind expression with dependencies in this attribute; for more information see the Usage section. Note: If a CFML page specified in this attribute contains tags that use AJAX features, such as cfform, cfgrid, and cfwindow, you must use a cfajaximport tag on the page with the cfpod tag. For more information, see cfajaximport.

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: Text to display in the pod�s title bar. You can use HTML mark up to control the title appearance, of example to show the text in red italic font. If you omit this attribute, the pod does not have a title bar.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Width if the control, including the title bar and borders, in pixels. Default is 500.

tag.name: cfpop
tag.help: Retrieves or deletes e-mail messages from a POP mail server.

parameter.name: server
parameter.help: POP server identifier: A host name; for example, "biff.upperlip.com" An IP address; for example, "192.1.2.225"

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: POP port

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Overrides username.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Overrides password

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: getHeaderOnly: returns message header information only getAll: returns message header information, message text, and attachments if attachmentPath is specified delete: deletes messages on POP server

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for query object that contains the retrieved message information.

parameter.name: messagenumber
parameter.help: Message number or comma-delimited list of message numbers to get or delete. Invalid message numbers are ignored. Ignored if uid is specified.

parameter.name: uid
parameter.help: UID or a comma-delimited list of UIDs to get or delete. Invalid UIDs are ignored.

parameter.name: attachmentpath
parameter.help:
If action="getAll", specifies a directory in which to save any attachments. If the directory does not exist, CFML creates it.
If you omit this attribute, CFML does not save any attachments. If you specify a relative path, the path root is the CFML temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Maximum time, in seconds, to wait for mail processing

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Number of messages to return or delete, starting with the number in startRow. Ignored if messageNumber or uid is specified.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: First row number to get or delete. Ignored if messageNumber or uid is specified.

parameter.name: generateuniquefilenames
parameter.help: Yes: Generate unique filenames for files attached to an e-mail message, to avoid naming conflicts when files are saved

tag.name: cfprocessingdirective
tag.help:
Provides the following insformation to CFML on how to process the current page:
* Specifies whether to remove excess whitespace character from CFML generated content in the tag body. * Identifies the character encoding (character set) of the page contents.

parameter.name: suppresswhitespace
parameter.help: Boolean; whether to suppress white space characters within the cfprocessingdirective block that are generated by CFML tags and often do not affect HTML appearance. Does not affect any white space in HTML code.

parameter.name: pageencoding
parameter.help:
A string literal; cannot be a variable. Identifies the character encoding of the current CFML page. This attribute affects the entire page, not just the cfprocessing tag body. The value may be enclosed in single or double quotation marks, or none.
For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.

tag.name: cfprocparam
tag.help: Defines stored procedure parameters. This tag is nested within a cfstoredproc tag.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: in: The parameter is used to send data to the database system only. Passes the parameter by value. out: The parameter is used to receive data from the database system only. Passes the parameter as a bound variable. inout: The parameter is used to send and receive data. Passes the parameter as a bound variable.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: CFML variable name; references the value that the output parameter has after the stored procedure is called.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value that CFML passes to the stored procedure.

parameter.name: cfsqltype
parameter.help: SQL type to which the parameter (any type) is bound. CFML supports the following values, where the last element of the name corresponds to the SQL data type. Different database systems might support different subsets of this list. See your DBMS documentation for information on supported parameter types.

parameter.name: maxlength
parameter.help: Maximum length of a string or character IN or INOUT value attribute. A maxLength of 0 allows any length. The maxLength attribute is not required when specifying type=out.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.help: Number of decimal places in numeric parameter. A scale of 0 allows any number of decimal places.

parameter.name: null
parameter.help: Whether the parameter is passed in as a null value. Not used with OUT type parameters.

parameter.name: dbvarname
parameter.help: Stored procedure variable name. Directly matches to the name of the procedure parameter.

tag.name: cfprocresult
tag.help: Associates a query object with a result set returned by a stored procedure. Other CFML tags, such as cfoutput and cftable, use this query object to access the result set. This tag is nested within a cfstoredproc tag.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for the query result set.

parameter.name: resultset
parameter.help: Names one result set, if stored procedure returns more than one.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows returned in result set.

tag.name: cfproperty
tag.help: Defines properties of a CFML component (CFC). Used to create complex data types for web services. The attributes of this tag are exposed as component metadata and are subject to inheritance rules.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A string; a property name. Must be a static value.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: A string; identifies the property data type

parameter.name: abort
parameter.help: Specifies whether to stops processing the current page at the tag location or not

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: Whether the parameter is required

parameter.name: default
parameter.help:
If no property value is set when the component is used for a web service, specifies a default value.
If this attribute is present, the required attribute must be set to "no" or not specified.

parameter.name: displayname
parameter.help: A value to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. The value appears in parentheses following the property name.

parameter.name: hint
parameter.help: Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. This attribute can be useful for describing the purpose of the parameter.

tag.name: cfquery
tag.help: Passes queries or SQL statements to a data source. It is recommended that you use the cfqueryparam tag within every cfquery tag, to help secure your databases from unauthorized users

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of query. Used in page to reference query record set. Must begin with a letter. Can include letters, numbers, and underscores.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: Name of data source from which query gets data.

parameter.name: dbtype
parameter.help: query. Use this value to specify the results of a query as input.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Overrides username in data source setup.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Overrides password in data source setup.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows to return in record set. -1 returns all records.

parameter.name: blockfactor
parameter.help: Maximum rows to get at a time from server. Range: 1 - 100. Might not be supported by some database systems.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help:
Maximum number of seconds that each action of a query is permitted to execute before returning an error. The cumulative time may exceed this value.
For JDBC statements, CFML sets this attribute. For other drivers, check driver documentation.

parameter.name: cachedafter
parameter.help:
Date value (for example, April 16, 1999, 4-16-99). If date of original query is after this date, CFML uses cached query data. To use cached data, current query must use same SQL statement, data source, query name, user name, password.
A date/time object is in the range 100 AD-9999 AD.
When specifying a date value as a string, you must enclose it in quotation marks.

parameter.name: cachedwithin
parameter.help:
Timespan, using the CreateTimeSpan function. If original query date falls within the time span, cached query data is used. CreateTimeSpan defines a period from the present, back. Takes effect only if query caching is enabled in the Administrator.
To use cached data, the current query must use the same SQL statement, data source, query name, user name, and password.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.help: Yes: If debugging is enabled, but the Administrator Database Activity option is not enabled, displays SQL submitted to datasource and number of records returned by query. No: If the Administrator Database Activity option is enabled, suppresses display.

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: Specifies a name for the structure in which cfquery returns the result variables. * SQL: The SQL statement that was executed. (string) * Cached: If the query was cached. (boolean) * SqlParameters: An ordered Array of cfqueryparam values. (array) * RecordCount: Total number of records in the query. (numeric) * ColumnList: Column list, comma seperated. (numeric) * ExecutionTime: Execution time for the SQL request. (numeric)

tag.name: cfqueryparam
tag.help:
Verifies the data type of a query parameter and, for DBMSs that support bind variables, enables CFML to use bind variables in the SQL statement. Bind variable usage enhances performance when executing a cfquery statement multiple times.
This tag is nested within a cfquery tag, embedded in a query SQL statement. If you specify optional parameters, this tag performs data validation.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help:
Value that CFML passes to the right of the comparison operator in a where clause.
If CFSQLType is a date or time option, ensure that the date value uses your DBMS-specific date format. Use the CreateODBCDateTime or DateFormat and TimeFormat functions to format the date value.

parameter.name: cfsqltype
parameter.help: SQL type that parameter (any type) is bound to.

parameter.name: maxlength
parameter.help: Maximum length of parameter.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.help: Number of decimal places in parameter. Applies to CF_SQL_NUMERIC and CF_SQL_DECIMAL.

parameter.name: null
parameter.help:
Whether parameter is passed as a null value.
Yes: tag ignores the value attribute No: does not

parameter.name: list
parameter.help: Yes: The value attribute value is a delimited list No: it is not

parameter.name: separator
parameter.help: Character that separates values in list, in value attribute.

tag.name: cfregistry
tag.help: Reads, writes, and deletes keys and values in the system registry. Provides persistent storage of client variables. Deprecated for the UNIX platform. Note: For this tag to execute, it must be enabled in the ColdFusion MX Administrator.

parameter.name: branch
parameter.help: Name of a registry branch.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.help: Registry value to access. Note: For key deletion this attribute is required.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Variable into which to put value.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: * string: returns string values. * dWord: returns DWord values. * key: returns keys. * any: returns keys and values.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of record set to contain returned keys and values.

parameter.name: sort
parameter.help: Sorts query column data (case-insensitive). Sorts on Entry, Type, and Value columns as text. Specify a combination of columns from query output, in a comma-delimited list. For example: sort = "value desc, entry asc" * asc: ascending (a to z) sort order. * desc: descending (z to a) sort order.

parameter.name: directory
parameter.help: Absolute pathname of directory against which to perform action.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for output record set.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.help: File extension filter applied to returned names. For example: *.cfm. One filter can be applied.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.help: Applies only to UNIX and Linux. Permissions. Octal values of Unix chmod command. Assigned to owner, group, and other, respectively.

parameter.name: sort
parameter.help: Query column(s) by which to sort directory listing. Delimited list of columns from query output.

parameter.name: newdirectory
parameter.help: New name for directory.

parameter.name: recurse
parameter.help: Whether ColdFusion performs the action on subdirectories.

tag.name: cfreport
tag.help: Used to do either of the following: - Execute a report definition created with the ColdFusion Report Builder, displaying it in PDF, FlashPaper, or Excel format. You can optionally save this report to a file. - Run a predefined Crystal Reports report. Applies only to Windows systems. Uses the CFCRYSTAL.exe file to generate reports. Sets parameters in the Crystal Reports engine according to its attribute values.

parameter.name: template
parameter.help: Specifies the path to the report definition file, relative to the web root.

parameter.name: format
parameter.help: Specifies the output format.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the ColdFusion variable that will hold the report output. You cannot specify both name and filename.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.help: The filename to contain the report. You cannot specify both name and filename.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: The name of the query that contains input data for the report. If you omit this parameter, the report definition obtains data from the internal SQL or from cfreportparam items.

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.help: Specifies whether to overwrite files that have the same name as that specified in the filename attribute. Default: false

parameter.name: encryption
parameter.help: Specifies whether the output is encrypted. PDF format only. Default: none

parameter.name: ownerpassword
parameter.help: Specifies an owner password. PDF format only.

parameter.name: userpassword
parameter.help: Specifies a user password. PDF format only.

parameter.name: permissions
parameter.help: Specifies one or more permissions. PDF format only. Separate multiple permissions with a comma.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: Name of registered or native data source.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: * standard (not valid for Crystal Reports 8.0) * netscape * microsoft

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Maximum time, in seconds, in which a connection must be made to a Crystal Report.

parameter.name: report
parameter.help: Report path. Store Crystal Reports files in the same directories as CFML page files.

parameter.name: orderby
parameter.help: Orders results according to your specifications.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Username required for entry into database from which report is created. Overrides default settings for data source in CFML Administrator.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Password that corresponds to username required for database access. Overrides default settings for data source in CFML Administrator.

parameter.name: formula
parameter.help:
One or more named formulas. Terminate each formula with a semicolon. Use the format:
formula = "formulaname1='formula1';formulaname2='formula2';"
If you use a semicolon in a formula, you must escape it by typing it twice (;;). For example:
formula = "Name1 = 'Val_1a;;Val_1b';Name2 = 'Val2';"

tag.name: cfreportparam
tag.help: Passes input parameters to a ColdFusion Report Builder report definition. Allowed inside cfreport tag bodies only.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Variable name for data that is passed. The ColdFusion Report Builder report definition must include an input parameter that matches this name.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value of the data that is sent.

tag.name: cfrethrow
tag.help: Rethrows the currently active exception. Preserves the exception's cfcatch.type and cfcatch.tagContext variable values.

tag.name: cfreturn
tag.help: Returns result values from a component method. Contains an expression returned as result of the function. An expression; the result of the function from which this tag is called.

tag.name: cfsavecontent
tag.help: Saves the generated content of the cfsavecontent tag, including the results of evaluating expressions and executing custom tags, in the specified variable.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Name ofthe variable in which to save the generated content of the tag.

tag.name: cfschedule
tag.help: Provides a programmatic interface to the CFML scheduling engine. Can run a CFML page at scheduled intervals, with the option to write the page output to a static HTML page. This feature enables you to schedule pages that publish data, such as reports, without waiting while a database transaction is performed to populate the page.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: delete: deletes the specified task update: updates an existing task or creates a new task, if one with the name specified by the task attribute does not exist run: executes the specified task

parameter.name: task
parameter.help: Name of the task.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.help: Operation that the scheduler performs. Must be HTTPRequest.

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: Name of the file in which to store the published output of the scheuled task

parameter.name: path
parameter.help: Path to the directory in which to put the published file.

parameter.name: startdate
parameter.help: Date on which to first run the scheuled task.

parameter.name: starttime
parameter.help: Time at which to run the scheduled of task starts.

parameter.name: URL
parameter.help: URL of the page to execute.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Port to use on the server that is specified by the url parameter. If resolveURL = "yes", retrieved document URLs that specify a port number are automatically resolved, to preserve links in the retrieved document. A port value in the url attribute overrides this value.

parameter.name: publish
parameter.help: Yes: save the result to a file No: does not

parameter.name: enddate
parameter.help: Date when scheduled task ends.

parameter.name: endtime
parameter.help: Time when scheduled task ends (seconds).

parameter.name: interval
parameter.help: Interval at which task is scheduled. * number of seconds (minimum is 60) * once * daily * weekly * monthly

parameter.name: requesttimeout
parameter.help: Can be used to extend the default timeout period.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Username, if URL is protected.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Password, if URL is protected.

parameter.name: proxyserver
parameter.help: Host name or IP address of a proxy server.

parameter.name: proxyport
parameter.help: Port number to use on the proxy server.

parameter.name: proxyuser
parameter.help: User name to provide to the proxy server.

parameter.name: proxypassword
parameter.help: Password to provide to the proxy server.

parameter.name: resolveurl
parameter.help: Yes: resolve links in the output page to absolute references No: does not

tag.name: cfscript
tag.help:
Encloses a code block that contains cfscript statements.
You cannot use some CFML reserved words in this tag. You cannot put a user-defined function whose name begins with any of these strings within this tag: cf,cf_,_cf,CFML,CFML_,_CFML

tag.name: cfsearch
tag.help:
Searches Verity collections using CFML or K2Server, whichever search engine a collection is registered by. (CFML can also search collections that have not been registered, with the cfcollection tag.)
A collection must be created and indexed before this tag can return search results.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the search query.

parameter.name: collection
parameter.help:
One or more collection names. You can specify more than one collection unless you are performing a category search (that is, specifying category or categoryTree).
One or more collection names. You can specify more than one collection unless you are performing a category search (that is, specifying category or categoryTree).

parameter.name: category
parameter.help: A list of categories, separated by commas, to which the search is limited. If specified, and the collection does not have categories enabled, ColdFusion throws an exception.

parameter.name: categorytree
parameter.help: The location in a hierarchical category tree at which to start the search. ColdFusion searches at and below this level. If specified, and the collection does not have categories enabled, ColdFusion throws an exception. Can be used in addition to category attribute.

parameter.name: status
parameter.help: Specifies the name of the structure variable into which ColdFusion places search information, including alternative criteria suggestions (spelling corrections).

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Used to specify the parser that Verity uses to process the criteria. - simple: STEM and MANY operators are implicitly used. - explicit: operators must be invoked explicitly. Also known as Bool_Plus) - internet: for documents that are mostly WYSIWIG (what-you-see-is-what-you-get) documents. Also known as Internet_advanced. - internet_basic: minimizes search time. - natural: specifies the Query By Example (QBE) parser. Also known as FreeText.

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.help: Search criteria. Follows the syntax rules of the type attribute. If you pass a mixed-case entry in this attribute, the search is case-sensitive. If you pass all uppercase or all lowercase, the search is case-insensitive. Follow Verity syntax and delimiter character rules; see Using Verity Search Expressions in Developing CFML MX Applications.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows to return in query results. Default: all

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: First row number to get. Default: 1

parameter.name: suggestions
parameter.help: Specifies whether Verity returns spelling suggestions for possibly misspelled words. Use one of the following options: - always: Verity always returns spelling suggestions. - never: Verity never returns spelling suggestions. - positive integer: Verity returns spelling suggestions if the number of documents retrieved by the search is less than or equal to the number specified. There is a small performance penalty for retrieving suggestion data. Default: never

parameter.name: contextpassages
parameter.help: The number of passages/sentences Verity returns in the context summary (that is, the context column of the results). Default: 3

parameter.name: contextbytes
parameter.help: The maximum number of bytes Verity returns in the context summary. Default: 300

parameter.name: contexthighlightbegin
parameter.help: The HTML to prepend to search terms in the context summary. Use this attribute in conjunction with contextHighlightEnd to highlight search terms in the context summary. Default: <b>

parameter.name: contexthighlightend
parameter.help: The HTML to prepend to search terms in the context summary. Use this attribute in conjunction with contextHighlightEnd to highlight search terms in the context summary. Default:

parameter.name: previouscriteria
parameter.help: The name of a result set from an existing set of search results. Verity searches the result set for criteria without regard to the previous search score or rank. Use this attribute to implement searching within result sets.

tag.name: cfselect
tag.help:
Constructs a drop-down list box form control. Used within a cfform tag.
You can populate the list from a query, or by using the HTML option tag.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the select form element

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: ID for form input element.

parameter.name: bind
parameter.help: A bind expression that dynamically sets an attribute of the control.

parameter.name: bindAttribute
parameter.help: Specifies the HTML tag attribute whose value is set by the bind attribute. You can only specify attributes in the browser’s HTML DOM tree, not ColdFusion- specific attributes. Ignored if there is no bind attribute.

parameter.name: bindOnLoad
parameter.help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to execute the bind attribute expression when first loading the form. Ignored if there is no bind attribute.

parameter.name: editable
parameter.help: Boolean value specifying whether you can edit the contents of the control.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: Label to put next to the control on a Flash or XML-format form.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: In HTML or XML format forms, ColdFusion passes the style attribute to the browser or XML. In Flash format, must be a style specification in CSS format, with the same syntax and contents as used in Macromedia Flex for the corresponding Flash element. Post alpha we will document specifics.

parameter.name: sourceForTooltip
parameter.help: The URL of a page to display as a tool tip. The page can include CFML and HTML markup to control the tip contents and format, and the tip can include images. If you specify this attribute, an animated icon appears with the text "Loading..." while the tip is being loaded.

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: Number of entries to display at one time. The default, 1, displays a drop-down list. Any other value displays a list box with size number of entries visible at one time.

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: If true a list element must be selected when form is submitted. Note: This attribute has no effect if you omit the size attribute or set it to 1 because the browser always submits the displayed item. You can work around this issue format forms by having an initial option tag with value=" " (note the space character between the quotation marks). Default: false

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message to display if required="true" and no selection is made.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

parameter.name: multiple
parameter.help: - true: allow selecting multiple elements in drop-down list - false: don't allow selecting multiple elements Default: false

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Name of query to populate drop-down list.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Query column to use for the value of each list element. Used with query attribute.

parameter.name: display
parameter.help: Query column to use for the display label of each list element. Used with query attribute.

parameter.name: group
parameter.help: Query column to use to group the items in the drop-down list into a two-level hierarchical list..

parameter.name: queryposition
parameter.help: If you populate the options list with a query and use HTML option child tags to specify additional entries, determines the location of the items from the query relative to the items from the option tags: - above: Put the query items above the options items. - below: Put the query items below the options items. Default: above

parameter.name: selected
parameter.help: One or more option values to preselect in the selection list. To specify multiple values, use a comma-delimited list. This attribute applies only if selection list items are generated from a query. The cfform preservedata attribute value can override this value.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

parameter.name: onkeyup
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a keyboard key in the control.

parameter.name: onkeydown
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) ActionScript to run when the user depresses a keyboard key in the control.

parameter.name: onmouseup
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user presses a mouse button in the control.

parameter.name: onmousedown
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a mouse button in the control.

parameter.name: onchange
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the control changes due to user action.

parameter.name: onclick
parameter.help: JavaScript to run when the user clicks the control.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true

parameter.name: visible
parameter.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: The height of the control, in pixels.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: The width of the control, in pixels.

parameter.name: passthrough
parameter.help:
This attribute is deprecated.
Passes arbitrary attribute-value pairs to the HTML code that is generated for the tag. You can use either of the following formats:
passthrough="title=""myTitle""" passthrough='title="mytitle"'

tag.name: cfset
tag.help: Sets a value in CFML. Used to create a variable, if it does not exist, and assign it a value. Also used to call functions.

tag.name: cfsetting
tag.help: Controls aspects of page processing, such as the output of HTML code in pages.

parameter.name: enablecfoutputonly
parameter.help: Yes: blocks output of HTML that is outside cfoutput tags No: displays HTML that is outside cfoutput tags.

parameter.name: showdebugoutput
