parameter.help: Yes: If debugging is enabled in the Administrator, displays debugging information No: suppresses debugging information that would otherwise display at end of generated page.

parameter.name: requesttimeout
parameter.help: Integer; number of seconds. Time limit, after which CFML processes the page as an unresponsive thread. Overrides the timeout set in the CFML Administrator.

tag.name: cfsilent
tag.help: Suppresses output produced by CFML within a tag's scope.

tag.name: cfslider
tag.help: Puts a slider control, for selecting a numeric value from a range, in a ColdFusion form. The slider moves over the slider groove. As the user moves the slider, the current value displays. Used within a cfform tag. Not supported with Flash forms.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for cfslider control.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: Label to display with control. For example, "Volume" This displays: "Volume %value%" To reference the value, use "%value%". If %% is omitted, slider value displays directly after label.

parameter.name: range
parameter.help: Numeric slider range values. Separate values with a comma.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.help: Unsigned integer. Defines slider scale, within range. For example: if range = "0,1000" and scale = "100", the display values are: 0, 100, 200, 300, ... Signed and unsigned integers in ColdFusion are in the range -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Starting slider setting. Must be within the range values.

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to validate user input; in this case, a change to the default slider value. Specify only the function name.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message text to appear if validation fails.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails. Specify only the function name.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Slider control height, in pixels.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Slider control width, in pixels.

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Vertical spacing above and below slider, in pixels.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of slider, in pixels.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Alignment of slider: * top * left * bottom * baseline * texttop * absbottom * middle * absmiddle * right

parameter.name: lookandfeel
parameter.help: - motif: renders slider in Motif style - windows: renders slider in Windows style - metal: renders slider in Java Swing style If platform does not support style option, tag defaults to platform default style. Default: windows

parameter.name: vertical
parameter.help: Yes: Renders slider in browser vertically. You must set width and height attributes; ColdFusion does not automatically swap width and height values. No: Renders slider horizontally.

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: Background color of control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: textcolor
parameter.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font name for data in tree control.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Font size for text in tree control, in points.

parameter.name: italic
parameter.help: Yes: displays tree control text in italics No: it does not

parameter.name: bold
parameter.help: Yes: displays tree control text in bold No: it does not

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help:
Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled. Default: "Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!"

values.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

tag.name: cfstoredproc
tag.help: Executes a stored procedure in a server database. It specifies database connection information and identifies the stored procedure.

parameter.name: procedure
parameter.help: Name of stored procedure on database server.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: Name of data source that points to database that contains stored procedure.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Overrides username in data source setup.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Overrides password in data source setup.

parameter.name: blockfactor
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows to get at a time from server. Range is 1 to 100.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.help: Yes: Lists debug information on each statement No: does not

parameter.name: returncode
parameter.help: Yes: Tag populates cfstoredproc.statusCode with status code returned by stored procedure. No: does not

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: Specifies a name for the structure in which cfstoredproc returns the statusCode and ExecutionTime variables. If set, this value replaces cfstoredproc as the prefix to use when accessing those variables.

tag.name: cfswitch
tag.help: Evaluates a passed expression and passes control to the cfcase tag that matches the expression result. You can, optionally, code a cfdefaultcase tag, which receives control if there is no matching cfcase tag value.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.help: CFML expression that yields a scalar value. CFML converts integers, real numbers, Booleans, and dates to numeric values. For example, True, 1, and 1.0 are all equal.

tag.name: cftable
tag.help:
Builds a table in a CFML page. This tag renders data as preformatted text, or, with the HTMLTable attribute, in an HTML table. If you do not want to write HTML table tag code, or if your data can be presented as preformatted text, use this tag. Preformatted text (defined in HTML with the 
 and
tags) displays text in a fixed-width font. It displays white space and line breaks exactly as they are written within the pre tags. For more information, see an HTML reference guide. To define table column and row characteristics, use the cfcol tag within this tag.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Name of cfquery from which to draw data.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows to display in the table.

parameter.name: colspacing
parameter.help: Number of spaces between columns

parameter.name: headerlines
parameter.help: Number of lines to use for table header (the default leaves one line between header and first row of table).

parameter.name: htmltable
parameter.help:
Renders data in an HTML 3.0 table.
If you use this attribute (regardless of its value), CFML renders data in an HTML table.

parameter.name: border
parameter.help:
Displays border around table.
If you use this attribute (regardless of its value), CFML displays a border around the table.
Use this only if you use the HTMLTable attribute.

parameter.name: colheaders
parameter.help:
Displays column heads. If you use this attribute, you must also use the cfcol tag header attribute to define them.
If you use this attribute (regardless of its value), CFML displays column heads.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: The query result row to put in the first table row.

tag.name: cftextarea
tag.help: Puts a multiline text entry box in a cfform tag and controls its display characteristics.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the cftextinput control.

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: ID for form input element.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: Label to put beside the control on a form.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: In HTML or XML format forms, ColdFusion passes the style attribute to the browser or XML. In Flash format forms, must be a style specification in CSS format, with the same syntax and contents as used in Macromedia Flex for the corresponding Flash element.

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: - true: the field must contain text. - false: the field can be empty. Default: false

parameter.name: validate
parameter.help: The type or types of validation to do. Available validation types and algorithms depend on the format. For details, see the Usage section of the cfinput tag reference.

parameter.name: validateat
parameter.help: How to do the validation. For Flash format forms, onSubmit and onBlur are identical; validation is done on submit. For multiple values, use a comma-delimited list. For details, see the Usage section of the cfinput tag reference. Default: onSubmit

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message text to display if validation fails.

parameter.name: range
parameter.help: Minimum and maximum numeric allowed values. ColdFusion uses this attribute only if you specify range in the validate attribute. If you specify a single number or a single number a followed by a comma, it is treated as a minimum, with no maximum. If you specify a comma followed by a number, the maximum is set to the specified number, with no minimum.

parameter.name: maxlength
parameter.help: The maximum length of text that can be entered. ColdFusion uses this attribute only if you specify maxlength in the validate attribute.

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.help: JavaScript regular expression pattern to validate input. Omit leading and trailing slashes. ColdFusion uses this attribute only if you specify regex in the validate attribute.

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to validate user input. The JavaScript DOM form object, input object, and input object value are passed to routine, which should return True if validation succeeds, False otherwise. If you specify this attribute, ColdFusion ignores the validate attribute.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.help: Disables user input, making the control read-only. To disable input, specify disabled without an attribute, or disabled="true". To enable input, omit the attribute or specify disabled="false". Default: false

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Initial value to display in text control. You can specify an initial value as an attribute or in the tag body, but not in both places. If you specify the value as an attribute, you must put the closing cftextarea tag immediately after the opening cftextarea tag, with no spaces or line feeds between, or place a closing slash at the end of the opening cftextarea tag. For example: <cftextarea name="description" value="Enter a description." />

parameter.name: bind
parameter.help: Flash only: A Flex bind expression that populates the field with information from other form fields.

parameter.name: onkeyup
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a keyboard key in the control.

parameter.name: onkeydown
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) ActionScript to run when the user presses a keyboard key in the control.

parameter.name: onmouseup
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user presses a mouse button in the control.

parameter.name: onmousedown
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a mouse button in the control.

parameter.name: onchange
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the control changes due to user action.

parameter.name: onclick
parameter.help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) to run when the user clicks the control. Not supported for Flash forms.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the control is enabled. A disabled control appears in light gray. The inverse of the diabled attribute. Default: true

parameter.name: visible
parameter.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Flash only: The height of the control, in pixels.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Flash only: The width of the control, in pixels.

tag.name: cftextinput
tag.help:
This tag is deprecated.
Puts a single-line text entry box in a cfform tag and controls its display characteristics.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for the cftextinput control.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Initial value to display in text control.

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: Yes: the user must enter or change text No

parameter.name: range
parameter.help: Minimum-maximum value range, delimited by a comma. Valid only for numeric data.

parameter.name: validate
parameter.help: date: verifies format mm/dd/yy. eurodate: verifies date format dd/mm/yyyy. time: verifies time format hh:mm:ss. float: verifies floating point format. integer: verifies integer format. telephone: verifies telephone format ###-###-####. The separator can be a blank. Area code and exchange must begin with digit 1 - 9. zipcode: verifies, in U.S. formats only, 5- or 9-digit format #####-####. The separator can be a blank. creditcard: strips blanks and dashes; verifies number using mod10 algorithm. Number must have 13-16 digits. social_security_number: verifies format ###-##-####. The separator can be a blank. regular_expression: matches input against pattern attribute.

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object value are passed to routine, which should return True if validation succeeds, False otherwise. The validate attribute is ignored.

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.help: JavaScript regular expression pattern to validate input. Omit leading and trailing slashes

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message text to display if validation fails

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: Number of characters displayed before horizontal scroll bar displays.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font name for data in tree control.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Font size for text in tree control, in points.

parameter.name: italic
parameter.help: Yes: displays tree control text in italics No: it does not

parameter.name: bold
parameter.help: Yes: displays tree control text in bold No: it does not

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Tree control height, in pixels.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Tree control width, in pixels.

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Vertical margin above and below tree control, in pixels.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of tree control, in pixels.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: * top * left * bottom * baseline * texttop * absbottom * middle * absmiddle * right

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: Background color of control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: textcolor
parameter.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: maxlength
parameter.help: The maximum length of text entered.

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help:
Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled. Default: "Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!"

values.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

tag.name: cfthrow
tag.help: Throws a developer-specified exception, which can be caught with a cfcatch tag that has any of the following type attribute options: type = "custom_type" type = "Application" type = "Any"

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: * A custom type * Application Do not enter another predefined type; types are not generated by CFML applications. If you specify Application, you need not specify a type for cfcatch.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message that describes exception event.

parameter.name: detail
parameter.help: Description of the event. CFML appends error position to description; server uses this parameter if an error is not caught by your code.

parameter.name: errorcode
parameter.help: A custom error code that you supply.

parameter.name: extendedinfo
parameter.help: A custom error code that you supply.

parameter.name: object
parameter.help:
Requires the value of the cfobject tag name attribute.
Throws a Java exception from a CFML tag.
This attribute is mutually exclusive with all other attributes of this tag.

tag.name: cftimer
tag.help: Displays execution time for a specified section of CFML code. ColdFusion MX displays the timing information along with any output produced by the timed code.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: Label to display with timing information. Default: " "

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: - inline: displays timing information inline, following the resulting HTML. - outline: displays timing information and also displays a line around the output produced by the timed code. The browser must support the FIELDSET tag to display the outline. - comment: displays timing information in an HTML comment in the format <!-- label: elapsed-time ms -->. The default label is cftimer. - debug: displays timing information in the debug output under the heading CFTimer Times. Default: debug

tag.name: cftrace

parameter.name: abort
parameter.help: Calls cfabort tag when the tag is executed

parameter.name: category
parameter.help: User-defined string for identifying trace groups

parameter.name: inline
parameter.help: Displays trace code in line on the page in the location of the cftrace tag, addition to the debugging information output.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: User-defined string, which can include simple variable, but not complex variables such as arrays. Outputs to cflog text attribute

parameter.name: type
parameter.help:
Corresponds to the cflog type attribute; displays an appropriate icon.
* Information * Warning * Error * Fatal Information

parameter.name: var
parameter.help:
The name of a simple or complex variable to display.
Useful for displaying a temporary value, or a value that does not display on any CFM page.

tag.name: cftransaction
tag.help: Instructs the database management system to treat multiple database operations as a single transaction. Provides database commit and rollback processing.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help:
• begin: the start of the block of code to execute
  • commit: commits a pending transaction
  • rollback: rolls back a pending transaction

parameter.name: isolation
parameter.help: ODBC lock type.

tag.name: cftree
tag.help: Inserts a tree control in a form. Validates user selections. Used within a cftree tag block. You can use a CFML query to supply data to the tree.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for tree control.

parameter.name: format
parameter.help: - applet: displays the tree using a Java applet in the browser, - flash: displays the tree using a Flash control - object: returns the tree as a ColdFusion structure with the name specified by the name attribute, For details of the structure contents, see "object format", below. - xml: Generates an XMLrepresentation of the tree. In XML format forms, includes the generated XML in the form. and puts the XML in a string variable with the name specified by the name attribute. Default: applet

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: - true: user must select an item in tree control - false: they do not Default: false

parameter.name: delimiter
parameter.help: Character to separate elements in form variable path. Default: \\

parameter.name: completepath
parameter.help: - true: start the Form.treename.path variable with the root of the tree path when cftree is submitted. - false: omit the root level from the Form.treename.path variable; the value starts with the first child node in the tree. For the preserveData attribute of cfform to work with the tree, you must set this attribute to Yes. For tree items populated by a query, if you use the cftreeitem queryasroot attribute to specify a root name, that value is returned. If you do not specify a root name, ColdFusion returns the query name. Default: false

parameter.name: appendkey
parameter.help: - true: if you use cftreeitem href attributes, ColdFusion appends a CFTREEITEMKEY query string variable with the value of the selected tree item to the cfform action URL. - false: do not append the tree item value to the URL. Default: true

parameter.name: highlighthref
parameter.help: - true: highlights as a link the displayed value for any cftreeitem tag that specifies a href attribute. - false: disables highlighting. Default: true

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: JavaScript function to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object value are passed to the specified routine, which should return True if validation succeeds; False, otherwise.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message to display if validation fails.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

parameter.name: lookandfeel
parameter.help: - motif: renders slider in Motif style - windows: renders slider in Windows style - metal: renders slider in Java Swing style If platform does not support style option, tag defaults to platform default style. Default: windows

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font name for data in tree control.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Font size for text in tree control, in points.

parameter.name: italic
parameter.help: - true: displays tree control text in italics - false: it does not Default: false

parameter.name: bold
parameter.help: - true: displays tree control text in bold - false: it does not Default: false

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Tree control height, in pixels. If you omit this attribute in Flash format, Flash automatically sizes the tree. Default: 320 (applet only)

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Tree control width, in pixels. If you omit this attribute in Flash format, Flash automatically sizes the tree. Default: 200 (applet only)

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Vertical margin above and below tree control, in pixels.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of tree control, in pixels.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Alignment of the tree control applet object.

parameter.name: border
parameter.help: - true: display a border around the tree control. - false: no border Default: true

parameter.name: hscroll
parameter.help: - true: permits horizontal scrolling - false: no horizontal scrolling Default: true

parameter.name: vscroll
parameter.help: - true: permits vertical scrolling - false: no vertical scrolling Default: true

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: Flash only: Must be a style specification in CSS format, with the same syntax and contents as used in Macromedia Flex for the corresponding Flash element.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether the control is enabled. A disabled control appears in light gray. Default: true

parameter.name: visible
parameter.help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.

parameter.name: onchange
parameter.help: Flash only: ActionScript to run when the control changes due to user action. If you specify an onChange event handler, the Form scope of the ColdFusion action page does not automatically get information about selected items. The ActionScript onChange event handler must handle all changes and selections.

parameter.name: onblur
parameter.help: Flash only: ActionScript that runs when the calendar loses focus. (Added in 7.0.1)

parameter.name: onfocus
parameter.help: Flash only: ActionScript that runs when the calendar loses focus. (Added in 7.0.1)

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help:
Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled. Default: "Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!"

values.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

tag.name: cftreeitem
tag.help: Populates a form tree control, created with the cftree tag, with elements. To display icons, you can use the img values that CFML provides, or reference your own icons.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value passed when cfform is submitted. When populating a tree with data from a cfquery, specify columns in a delimited list. Example: value = "dept_id,emp_id"

parameter.name: display
parameter.help: Tree item label. When populating a tree with data from a query, specify names in a delimited list. Example: display = "dept_name,emp_name"

parameter.name: parent
parameter.help: Value for tree item parent.

parameter.name: img
parameter.help:
Image name, filename, or file URL for tree item icon.
You can specify a custom image. To do so, include path and file extension; for example:
img = "../images/page1.gif"
To specify more than one image in a tree, or an image at the second or subsequent level, use commas to separate names, corresponding to level; for example:
img = "folder,document" img = ",document" (example of second level)

parameter.name: imgopen
parameter.help: Icon displayed with open tree item. You can specify icon filename with a relative path. You can use a CFML image.

parameter.name: href
parameter.help:
URL to associate with tree item or query column for a tree that is populated from a query. If href is a query column, its value is the value populated by query. If href is not recognized as a query column, it is assumed that its text is an HTML href.
When populating a tree with data from a query, HREFs can be specified in delimited list; for example:
href = "http://dept_svr,http://emp_svr"

parameter.name: target
parameter.help:
Target attribute of href URL. When populating a tree with data from a query, specify target in delimited list:
target = "FRAME_BODY,_blank"

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Query name to generate data for the treeitem.

parameter.name: queryAsRoot
parameter.help:
Defines query as the root level. This avoids having to create another parent cftreeitem.
* Yes * No * String to use as the root name If you do not specify a root name, CFML returns the query name as the root.

parameter.name: expand
parameter.help: Yes: expands tree to show tree item children No: keeps tree item collapsed

tag.name: cftry
tag.help: Used with one or more cfcatch tags. Together, they catch and process exceptions in CFML pages. Exceptions are events that disrupt the normal flow of instructions in a CFML page, such as failed database operations, missing include files, and developer-specified events.

tag.name: cfupdate
tag.help: Updates records in a data source from data in a CFML form or form Scope.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: Name of the data source that contains the table

parameter.name: tablename
parameter.help: Name of table to update. For ORACLE drivers, must be uppercase. For Sybase driver: case-sensitive; must be in same case as used when the table was created

parameter.name: tableowner
parameter.help: For data sources that support table ownership (for example, SQL Server, Oracle, Sybase SQL Anywhere), the table owner.

parameter.name: tablequalifier
parameter.help: For data sources that support table qualifiers. The purpose of table qualifiers is as follows: SQL Server and Oracle: name of database that contains table Intersolv dBASE driver: directory of DBF files

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Overrides username value specified in ODBC setup.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Overrides password value specified in ODBC setup.

parameter.name: formfields
parameter.help:
Comma-delimited list of form fields to update.
If a form field is not matched by a column name in the database, CFML throws an error.
The formFields lies must include the database table primary key field, which must be present in the form. It can be hidden.

tag.name: cfwddx
tag.help:
Serializes and deserializes CFML data structures to the XML-based WDDX format. The WDDX is an XML vocabulary for describing complex data structures in a standard, generic way. Implementing it lets you use the HTTP protocol to such information among application server platforms, application servers, and browsers.
This tag generates JavaScript statements to instantiate JavaScript objects equivalent to the contents of a WDDX packet or CFML data structure. Interoperates with Unicode.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: cfml2wddx: serialize CFML to WDDX wddx2cfml: deserialize WDDX to CFML cfml2js: serialize CFML to JavaScript wddx2js: deserialize WDDX to JavaScript

parameter.name: input
parameter.help: A value to process

parameter.name: output
parameter.help: Name of variable for output. If action = "WDDX2JS" or "CFML2JS", and this attribute is omitted, result is output in HTML stream.

parameter.name: toplevelvariable
parameter.help: Name of top-level JavaScript object created by deserialization. The object is an instance of the WddxRecordset object.

parameter.name: usetimezoneinfo
parameter.help: Whether to output time-zone information when serializing CFML to WDDX. - Yes: the hour-minute offset, represented in ISO8601 format, is output. - No: the local time is output.

parameter.name: validate
parameter.help: Applies if action = "wddx2cfml" or "wddx2js". - Yes: validates WDDX input with an XML parser using WDDX DTD. If parser processes input without error, packet is deserialized. Otherwise, an error is thrown. - No: no input validation

tag.name: cfwindow
tag.help: Creates a pop-up window in the browser. Does not create a separate browser pop-up instance.

parameter.name: bodyStyle
parameter.help: A CSS style specification for the window body. As a general rule, use this attribute to set color and font styles. Using this attribute to set the height and width, for example, can result in distorted output.

parameter.name: center
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to center the window over the browser window. • If true, ColdFusion ignores the x and y attribute values. • If false, and you do not specify x and y attributes, ColdFusion centers the window.

parameter.name: closable
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the user can close the window. If true, the window has an X close icon.

parameter.name: draggable
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the user can drag the window. To drag the window, click the mouse on the title bar and hold the button down while dragging. If the window does not have a title, users cannot drag it.

parameter.name: headerStyle
parameter.help: A CSS style specification for the window header. As a general rule, use this attribute to set color and font styles. Using this attribute to set the height and width, for example, can result in distorted output.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Height of the window in pixels. If you specify a value greater than the available space, the window occupies the available space and the resize handles do not appear. Default is 300.

parameter.name: initShow
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to display the window when the containing page first displays. If this value is false, use the ColdFusion.Layout.show JavaScript function to display the window.

parameter.name: minHeight
parameter.help: The minimum height, in pixels, to which users can resize the window. Default is 0.

parameter.name: minWidth
parameter.help: The minimum width, in pixels, to which users can resize the window. Default is 0.

parameter.name: modal
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the window is modal, that is, whether the user can interact with the main window while this window displays. If true, the user cannot interact with the main window.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the window. Must be unique on the pages. This attribute is required to interact with the window, including to dynamically show or hide it.

parameter.name: onBindError
parameter.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message. If you omit this attribute, and have specified a global error handler (by using the ColdFusion.setGlobalErrorHandlerfunction ), it displays the error message; otherwise a default error pop-up displays.

parameter.name: resizable
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether the user can resize the window.

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: A URL that returns the window contents. This attribute can use URL parameters to pass data to the page. ColdFusion uses standard page path resolution rules to locate the page. You can use a bind expressions in this attribute; for more information see the Usage section. Note: If a CFML page specified in this attribute contains tags that use AJAX features, such as cfform, cfgrid, and cfpod, you must use a cfajaximport tag on the page with the cfwindow tag. For more information, see cfajaximport

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: Text to display in the window's title bar. You can use HTML mark up to control the title appearance, of example to show the text in red italic font. If you omit this attribute, the window does not have a title bar.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Width of the control, including the title bar and borders, in pixels. Default is 500.

parameter.name: x
parameter.help: The X (horizontal) coordinate of the upper-left corner of the window, relative to the browser window. ColdFusion ignores this attribute if the center attribute value is true and if you do not set the y attribute value.

parameter.name: y
parameter.help: The Y (vertical) coordinate of the upper-left corner of the window, relative to the browser window. ColdFusion ignores this attribute if the center attribute value is true and if you do not set the x attribute value.

tag.name: cfxml
tag.help: Creates a CFML XML document object that contains the markup in the tag body. This tag can include XML and CFML tags. CFML processes the CFML code in the tag body, then assigns the resulting text to an XML document object variable.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Name of an xml variable

parameter.name: casesensitive
parameter.help: Maintains the case of document elements and attributes

tag.name: cfajaximport
tag.help: Controls the JavaScript files that are imported for use on pages that use ColdFusion AJAX tags and features.

parameter.name: scriptsrc
parameter.help: Specifies the URL, relative to the web root, of the directory that contains the JavaScript files used used by ColdFusion. When you use this attribute, the specified directory must have the same structure as the /CFIDE/scripts directory.

parameter.name: tags
parameter.help: A comma-delimited list of tags or tag-attribute combinations for which to import the supporting JavaScript files on this page.

tag.name: cfmenu
tag.help: Creates a menu or tool bar (a horizontally arranged menu). Any menu item can be the top level of a submenu.

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: The color of the menu background. You can use any valid HTML color specification. This specification is locally overridden by the menuStyle attribute of this tag and any cfmenuitem tag, but does affect the background of the surrounding color of a submenu whose background is controlled by a childStyle attribute

parameter.name: childstyle
parameter.help: A CSS style specification that applies to the items of the top level menu and all child menu items, including the children of submenus. This attribute lets you use a single style specification for all menu items.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: The font to be use for all child menu items. You can use any valid HTML font-family style attribute.

parameter.name: fontcolor
parameter.help: The color of the menu text. You can use any valid HTML color specification.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: The size of the font. Use a numeric value, such as 8, to specify a pixel character size. Use a percentage value, such as 80% to specify a size relative to the default font size. Font sizes over 20 pixels can result in submenu text exceeding the menu boundary.

parameter.name: menustyle
parameter.help: A CSS style specification that applies to the menu, including any parts of the menu that do not have items. If you do not specify style information in the cfmenuitem tags, this attribute controls the style of the top-level items.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the menu.

parameter.name: selectedfontcolor
parameter.help: The color of the text for the menu item that has the focus. You can use any valid HTML color specification.

parameter.name: selecteditemcolor
parameter.help: The color that highlights the menu item that has the focus. You can use any valid HTML color specification.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The orientation of menu.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: The width of a vertical menu; not valid for horizontal menus.

tag.name: cfmenuitem
tag.help: Defines an entry in a menu, including an item that is the head of a submenu.

parameter.name: display
parameter.help: The text to show as the menu item label.

parameter.name: childstyle
parameter.help: A CSS style specification that applies to all child menu items, including the children of submenus.

parameter.name: divider
parameter.help: This attribute specifies that the item is a divider. If you specify this attribute, you cannot specify any other attributes.

parameter.name: href
parameter.help: A URL link to activate or JavaScript function to call when the user clicks the menu item.

parameter.name: image
parameter.help: URL of an image to display at the left side of the menu item. The file type can be any format the browser can display. For most displays, you should use 15x15 pixel images, because larger images conflict with the menu item text

parameter.name: menustyle
parameter.help: A CSS style specification that controls the overall style of any submenu of this menu item. This attribute controls the submenu of the current menu item, but not to any child submenus of the submenu.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the menu item.

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: A CSS style specification that applies to the current menu item only. It is not overridden by the childStyle attribute.

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: The target in which to display the contents returned by the href attribute. The attribute can be a browser window or frame name, an HTML target value, such as _self.

tag.name: cfprint
tag.help: Prints specified pages from a PDF file. Use this tag to perform automated batch print jobs. You can use the cfprint tag to print any PDF document, including those generated by the cfdocument, cfpdf, and cfpdfform tag. Also, you can use this tag to print Report Builder reports exported in PDF format.

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: Source document to print. You can specify one of the following: • An absolute or relative pathname to a PDF document; for example, c:\work\myPDF.pdf or myPDF.pdf. The default directory is the template directory. • A PDF document variable in memory that is generated by the cfdocument tag or the cfpdf tag; for example, "myPDFdoc".

parameter.name: attributestruct
parameter.help: ColdFusion structure used to specify additional print instructions. Individually named attributes take precedence over the key-value pairs in the attribute structure.

parameter.name: copies
parameter.help: Number of copies to print. The value must be greater than or equal to 1.

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.help: Orientation of the page to be printed.

parameter.name: pages
parameter.help: Pages in the source file to print. Duplicate pages and pages beyond the total count of pages in the document are ignored as long as there is at least one page between 1 and the total number of pages in the document. You can combine individual page numbers and page ranges; for example, 1–3,6,10–20. If you do not specify a value for the pages attribute, ColdFusion prints the entire document.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Specifies either the owner or user password for the PDF source file. If the PDF file is password-protected, you must specify this attribute for the file to print.

parameter.name: papersize
parameter.help: Paper used for the print job. The value can be any returned by the GetPrinterInfo function. Valid

parameter.name: color
parameter.help: Color or monochrome printing

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Specifies the file type of the document being printed. PDF is the only valid value.

parameter.name: printer
parameter.help: The name of a printer. An example in Windows is “\\s1001prn02\NTN-2W- HP_BW02”. The default is the default printer for the account where the ColdFusion server is running.

tag.name: cfsprydataset
tag.help: Creates a Spry data set; can use bind parameters to get data from ColdFusion AJAX controls to populate the data set.

parameter.name: bind
parameter.help: A bind expression that returns XML data to populate the Spry data set. The bind expression can specify a CFC function or URL and can include bind parameters that represent the values of ColdFusion controls. For detailed information on specifying bind expressions, see HTML form data binding in cfinput.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the Spry data set.

parameter.name: onbinderror
parameter.help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating the bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message. If you omit this attribute, and have specified a global error handler (by using the ColdFusion.setGlobalErrorHandler function), the handler displays the error message; otherwise a default error pop-up displays.

parameter.name: options
parameter.help: A JavaScript object containing options to pass to the data set.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Specifies data set type, corresponding to the format of the data that is returned by the bind expression.

parameter.name: xpath
parameter.help: Valid for XML type data sets only. An XPath expression that extracts data from the XML returned by the bind expression. The data set contains only the data that matches the xpath expression.

tag.name: cftooltip
tag.help: Specifies tool tip text that displays when the user hovers the mouse pointer over the elements in the tag body. This tag does not require a form and is not used inside Flash forms.

parameter.name: preventoverlap
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to prevent the tooltip from overlapping the component that it describes.

parameter.name: autodismissdelay
parameter.help: The number of milliseconds between the time when the user moves the mouse pointer over the component (and leaves it there) and when the tooltip disappears.

parameter.name: hidedelay
parameter.help: The number of milliseconds to delay between the time when the user moves the mouse pointer away from the component and when the tooltip disappears.

parameter.name: showdelay
parameter.help: The number of milliseconds to delay between the time when the user moves the mouse over the component and when the tooltip appears.

parameter.name: sourcefortooltip
parameter.help: The URL of a page with the tool tip contents. The page can include HTML markup to control the format, and the tip can include images. If you specify this attribute, an animated icon appears with the text "Loading..." while the tip is being loaded.

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.help: Tip text to display. The text can include HTML formatting. Ignored if you specify a sourceForTooltip attribute

tag.name: cfajaxproxy
tag.help: Creates a JavaScript proxy for a ColdFusion component, for use in an AJAX client.

parameter.name: cfc
parameter.help: The CFC for which to create a proxy. You must specify a dot-delimited path to the CFC. The path can be absolute or relative to location of the CFML page. For example, if the myCFC CFC is in the cfcs subdirectory of the ColdFusion page, specify cfcs.myCFC. On UNIX based systems, the tag searches first for a file whos name or path corresponds to the specified name or path, but is in all lower case. If it does not find it, ColdFusion then searches for a file name or path that coresponds to the attribute value exactly, with identical character casing. (required)

parameter.name: jsclassname
parameter.help: The name to use for the JavaScript proxy class. (optional)

tag.name: cfexchangecalendar
tag.help: Creates, deletes, modifies, gets, and responds to Microsoft Exchange calendar events, and gets calendar event attachments.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: create, delete, get, getAttachments, modify, respond (required)

parameter.name: attachmentPath
parameter.help: The file path of the destination directory. If the directory does not exist, ColdFusion creates it. If you omit this attribute, ColdFusion does not save any attachments. If you specify a relative path, the path root is the ColdFusion temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function. (optional)

parameter.name: connection
parameter.help: The name of the connection to the Exchange server, as specified in the cfexchangeconnection tag. If you omit this attribute, you must create a temporary connection by specifying cfexchangeconnection tag connection attributes in the cfexchangecalendar tag. (optional)

parameter.name: event
parameter.help: A reference to the structure that contains the event properties to be set or changed and their values. You must specify this attribute in number signs (#). (required)

parameter.name: generateUnique Filenames
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to generate unique file names if multiple attachments have the same file names. Case "yes": 3x myfile.txt -> myfile.txt, myfile1.txt, and myfile2.txt. (optional, default=no)

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: The text of an optional message to send in the response or deletion notification. (optional)

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the ColdFusion query variable that will contain the retrieved events or information about the attachments that were retrieved. (required)

parameter.name: notify
parameter.help: Boolean value specifying whether to notify others of the changes made to the event (optional)

parameter.name: responseType
parameter.help: (respond) Must be one of the following: accept, decline, tentative (required)

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: The name of a variable that will contain the UID of the event that is created. You use the UID value in the uid attribute other actions to identify the event to be acted on. (optional)

parameter.name: uid
parameter.help: Case-sensitive Exchange UID value or values that uniquely identify the event or events on which to perform the action. For the delete action, this attribute can be a comma delimited list of UID values. The getAttachments, modify, and respond actions allow only a single UID value. (required)

tag.name: cfexchangeconnection
tag.help: Opens or closes a persistent connection to an Microsoft Exchange server. You must have a persistent or temporary connection to use the cfexchangecalendar, cfexchangecontact, cfexchangemail, and cfexchangetask tags to get or change information on the Exchange server.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: The action to take. Must be open or close. (required)

parameter.name: connection
parameter.help: The name of the connection. You specify this ID when you close the connection and in tags such as cfexchangemail. (required)

parameter.name: mailboxName
parameter.help: The ID of the Exchange mailbox to use. Specify this attribute to access a mailbox whose owner has delegated access rights to the account specified in the username attribute. (optional)

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: (open) The users password for accessing the Exchange server. (optional)

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: The port on the server connect to, most commonly port 80. (optional)

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.help: The protocol to use for the connection. Valid values are http and https. (optional)

parameter.name: proxyHost
parameter.help: The URL or IP address of the proxy host required for access to the network. (optional)

parameter.name: proxyPort
parameter.help: The port on the proxy server to connect to, most commonly port 80. (optional)

parameter.name: server
parameter.help: The IP address or URL of the server that is providing access to Exchange. (required)

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: The Exchange user ID (required)

tag.name: cfexchangecontact
tag.help: Creates, deletes, modifies, and gets Microsoft Exchange contact records, and gets contact record attachments.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: create, delete, get, getAttachments, modify (required)

parameter.name: attachmentPath
parameter.help: The absolute file path of the directory in which to put the attachments. If the directory does not exist, ColdFusion creates it. If you omit this attribute, ColdFusion does not save any attachments. (optional)

parameter.name: connection
parameter.help: The name of the connection to the Exchange server, as specified in the cfexchangeconnection tag. If you omit this attribute, you must create a temporary connection by specifying cfexchangeconnection tag connection attributes in the cfexchangecontact tag. (optional)

parameter.name: contact
parameter.help: A reference to the structure that contains the contact properties to be set or changed and their values. You must specify this attribute in number signs (#). For more information on the event structure, see the Usage section. (required)

parameter.name: generateUniqueFilenames
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to generate unique file names if multiple attachments have the same file names. Case "yes": 3x myfile.txt -> myfile.txt, myfile1.txt, and myfile2.txt. (optional, default=no)

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the ColdFusion query variable that will contain the retrieved events or information about the attachments that were retrieved. (required)

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: The name of a variable that will contain the UID of the contact that is created. You use this value in the uid attribute other actions to identify the contact to be acted on. (optional)

parameter.name: uid
parameter.help: A case-sensitive Exchange UID value that uniquely identifies the contacts on which to perform the action. For the delete action, this attribute can be a comma delimited list of UID values. The getAttachments and modify action allow only a single UID value. (required)

tag.name: cfexchangefilter
tag.help: Specifies the filter parameter for cfexchangemail, cfexchangecalendar, cfexchangetask, and cfexchangecontact, get operations.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The type of filter to use. (required)

parameter.name: from
parameter.help: The start date or or date/time combination of the range to use for filtering. Cannot be used with the value attribute. If you specify a from attribute without a to attribute, the filter selects for all entries on or after the specified date or time. The value can be in any date/time format recognized by ColdFusion, but must correspond to a value that is appropriate for the filter type. (optional)

parameter.name: to
parameter.help: The end date or date/time combination for the range used for filtering. Cannot be used with the value attribute. If you specify a to attribute without a from attribute, the filter selects for all entries on or before the specified date or time. The value can be in any date/time format recognized by ColdFusion, but must correspond to a value that is appropriate for the filter type. (optional)

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The filter value for all filters that do not take a date or time range. Cannot be used with the from and to attributes. If the name attribute requires this attribute, ColdFusion generates an error if it has an empty or null value. (optional)

tag.name: cfexchangemail
tag.help: Gets mail messages and attachments, deletes messages, and sets properties for messages on a Microsoft Exchange server. The cfexchangemail tag performs mail actions on an Exchange server that you cannot do using the cfmail tag.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: The name to use for the JavaScript proxy class. (required)

parameter.name: attachmentPath
parameter.help: The file path of the directory in which to put the attachments. If the directory does not exist, ColdFusion creates it. If you omit this attribute, ColdFusion does not save any attachments. If you specify a relative path, the path root is the ColdFusion temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function. (optional)

parameter.name: connection
parameter.help: The name of the connection to the Exchange server, as specified in the cfexchangeconnection tag. If you omit this attribute, and you specify cfexchangeconnection tag attributes in this tag, Coldfusion creates a temporary connection. (optional)

parameter.name: folder
parameter.help: The forward slash (/) delimited path, relative to the inbox, of the folder that contains the message or messages. The cfechangemail tag looks in the specified folder only, and does not search subfolders. If you omit this attribute, Exchange looks in the top level of the inbox. (optional)

parameter.name: generateUnique Filenames
parameter.help: A Boolean value specifying whether to generate unique file names if multiple attachments have the same file names. Case "yes": 3x myfile.txt -> myfile.txt, myfile1.txt, and myfile2.txt. (optional, default=no)

parameter.name: mailUID
parameter.help: The case-sensitive UID of the mail message that contains the meeting request, response, or cancellation notfication. You can use this attribute if there are multiple messages about a single meeting. (optional)

parameter.name: meetingUID
parameter.help: The case-sensitive UID of the meeting for which you received the notification. (required)

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: A reference to a structure that contains the properties to be set and their values. You must specify this attribute in number signs (#). (required)

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the ColdFusion query variable that will contain the returned mail messages or information about the attachments that were retrieved. (required)

parameter.name: UID
parameter.help: The case-sensitive UIDs of the messages on which to perform the action. For the delete action, this attribute can be a comma delimited list of UID values. The getAttachments and set actions allow only a single UID value. (required)

tag.name: cfexchangetask
tag.help: Creates, deletes, modifies, and gets Microsoft Exchange tasks, and gets task attachments.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: create, delete, get, getAttachments, modify (optional)

parameter.name: attachmentPath
parameter.help: The file path of the directory in which to put the attachments. If the directory does not exist, ColdFusion creates it. If you omit this attribute, ColdFusion does not save any attachments. If you specify a relative path, the path root is the ColdFusion temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function. (optional)

parameter.name: connection
parameter.help: The name of the connection to the Exchange server, as specified in the cfexchangeconnection tag. If you omit this attribute, and you specify cfexchangeconnection tag attributes in this tag, Coldfusion creates a temporary connection. (optional)

parameter.name: task
parameter.help: A reference to the structure that contains the task properties to be set or changed and their values. You must specify this attribute in number signs (#). For more information on the event structure, see the Usage section. (required)

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The name of the ColdFusion query variable that will contain the returned mail messages or information about the attachments that were retrieved. (required)

parameter.name: results
parameter.help: (create) The name of a variable that will contain the UID of the task that is created. You use this value in the uid attribute of other actions to identify the task to be acted on. (optional)

parameter.name: uid
parameter.help: A case-sensitive Exchange UID value that uniquely identifies the tasks on which to perform the action. For the delete action, this attribute can be a comma delimited list of UID values. The getAttachments and modify action allow only a single UID value. (optional)

tag.name: cffeed
tag.help: Reads or creates an RSS or Atom syndication feed. This tag can read RSS versions 0.90, 0.91, 0.92, 0.93, 0.94, 1.0, and 2.0, and Atom 0.3 or 1.0. It can create RSS 2.0 or Atom 1.0 feeds.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: The name to use for the JavaScript proxy class. The action to take, one of the following values: "create" Creates an RSS 2.0 or Atom 1.0 feed XML document and saves it in a variable, writes it to a file, or both. "read" Parses an RSS or Atom feed from a URL or an XML file and saves it in a structure or query. You can also get query metadata in a separate structure. (optional, default= read)

parameter.name: columnmap
parameter.help: Used only for the create action with a query attribute. A structure specifying a mapping between the names of the columns in the object specified by the query attribute and the columns of the ColdFusion feed format, as described in the Query attribute section. The key for each field must be a column name listed in the Query columns section. The value of the field must be the name of the corresponding column in the query object used as input to the create action. (optional)

parameter.name: enclosuredir
parameter.help: Used only for the read action. Path to the directory in which to save any enclosures that are available in the feed being read. The path can be absolute or relative to the CFML file. If the directory does not exist, ColdFusion generates an error. If you omit this attribute, ColdFusion does not save enclosures. To specify the directory that contains the current page, set this attribute to .(period). (optional)

parameter.name: ignoreenclosureerror
parameter.help: If this attribute is true, ColdFusion attempts to save all enclosures. If it encounters an error downloading one enclosure, it continues downloading other enclosures and writes the error information in the server log. If this attribute is false, ColdFusion stops downloading all enclosures and generates an error when it encounters an error downloading an enclosure. Note: Enclosure errors can occur if the specified enclosure is of a type that the web server does not allow to be downloaded. (optional, default=false)

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A structure that contains complete feed data: The output of a read action. The input definition of the feed to create. This structure contains complete feed information. When you specify the name attribute for a create action, you must put it in pound signs (#). (optional)

parameter.name: outputfile
parameter.help: Path of the file in which to write the feed as XML text. The path can be absolute, or relative to the CFML file. (optional)

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.help: Whether to overwrite the XML feed file if it already exists. If you do not set this attribute to true and the cffeed tag tries to write to a file that exists, ColdFusion generates an error. (optional, default=false)

parameter.name: overwriteenclosure
parameter.help: Used only for the read action. Whether to overwrite files in the enclosure directory if they already exist. If you do not set this attribute to true and the cffeed tag tries to write to a file that exists, ColdFusion generates an error. (optional, default=false)

parameter.name: properties
parameter.help: A structure containing the feed metadata, the information about the entire feed. Can contain either of the following: The output of a read action. Input to a create action. The properties and query attributes combined provide complete feed information. When you specify the properties attribute for a create action, you must put it in pound signs (#) (optional)

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: A query object containing the Atom entries or RSS items in the feed. Can contain either of the following: The output of a read action. Input to a create action. The properties and query attributes combined provide complete feed information. When you specify the query attribute for a create action, you must put it in pound signs (#) (optional)

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: Used only for the read action. The URL of the feed or the path to the XML file that contains the feed contents. A path can be absolute, or relative to the CFML file. (required)

parameter.name: jsclassname
parameter.help: A variable in which to save the read or created feed as XML text. (optional)

tag.name: cfimage
tag.help: Creates a ColdFusion image that can be manipulated by using Image functions. You can use the cfimage tag to perform common image manipulation operations as a shortcut to Image functions. You can use the cfimage tag independently or in conjunction with Image functions.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: border captcha convert info read resize rotate write writeToBrowser You do not need to specify the default action, read, explicitly. (optional, default=read)

parameter.name: angle
parameter.help: Angle in degrees to rotate the image. You must specify an integer for the value. (required)

parameter.name: color
parameter.help: (border) Border color. Hexadecimal value or supported named color. For a hexadecimal value, use the form "##xxxxxx" or "xxxxxx". (required)

parameter.name: destination
parameter.help: Absolute or relative pathname where the image output is written. The image format is determined by the file extension. The convert and write actions require a destination. The border, captcha, resize, and rotate actions require either a name attribute or a destination attribute. You can specify both. Scorpio supports only CAPTCHA images in PNG format. If you do not enter a destination, the CAPTCHA image is placed inline in the HTML output and displayed in the web browser. (optional)

parameter.name: difficulty
parameter.help: Level of complexity of the CAPTCHA text. Specify one of the following levels of text distortion: high medium low (optional, default=low)

parameter.name: fontSize
parameter.help: Font size of the text in the CAPTCHA image. The value must be an integer. (optional)

parameter.name: format
parameter.help: Format of the image displayed in the browser. If you do not specify a format, the image is displayed in PNG format. You cannot display a GIF image in a browser. GIF images are displayed in PNG format. (optional, Default=PNG)

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Height in pixels of the image. For the resize attribute, you also can specify the height as a percentage (an integer followed by the "%" symbol). The value must be an integer. (optional)

parameter.name: isBase64
parameter.help: Specifies whether the source is a Base64 string. The isBase64 values are: yes: the source is a Base64 string. no: the source is not a Base64 string. (optional, default=no)

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the ColdFusion image variable to create. The read action requires name attribute. The border, resize, and rotate options require a name attribute or a destination attribute. You can specify both. (optional)

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.help: Valid only if the destination attribute is specified. The overwrite values are: yes: overwrites the destination file. no: does not overwrite the destination file. If the destination file already exists, ColdFusion generates an error if the overwrite option is not set to yes. (optional, default=no)

parameter.name: quality
parameter.help: Quality of the JPEG destination file. Applies only to files with an extension of JPG or JPEG. Valid values are fractions that range from 0 through 1 (the lower the number, the lower the quality). (optional, default=0.75)

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: URL of the source image; for example, "http://www.google.com/ images/logo.gif" Absolute or relative pathname of the source image; for example, "c:\wwwroot\images\logo.jpg" ColdFusion image variable containing another image, BLOB, or byte array; for example, "#myImage#" Base64 string; for example, "data:image/jpg;base64,/9j/ 4AAQSkZJRgABAQA.............." (required)

parameter.name: structName
parameter.help: () Name of the ColdFusion structure to be created. (required)

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: Text string displayed in the CAPTCHA image. Use capital letters for better readability. (required)

parameter.name: thickness
parameter.help: Border thickness in pixels. The border is added to the outside edge of the source image, increasing the image area accordingly. The value must be an integer. (optional, default=1)

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Width in pixels of the image. For resize, you also can specify the width as a percentage (an integer followed by the "%" symbol). The value must be an integer. (required)

tag.name: cfinterface
tag.help: Defines an interface that consists of a set of signatures for functions. The interface does not include the full function definitions; instead, you implement the functions in a CFC. The interfaces that you define by using this tag can make up the structure of a reusable application framework.

parameter.name: displayName
parameter.help: A value to be displayed when using introspection to show a descriptive name for the interface. (optional)

parameter.name: extends
parameter.help: A comma delimited list of one or more interfaces that this interface extends. Any CFC that implements an interface must also implement all the functions in the interfaces specified by this property. If an interface extends another interface, and the child interface specifies a function with the same name as one in the parent interface, both functions must have the same attribues; otherwise ColdFusion generates an error. (optional)

parameter.name: displayName
parameter.help: Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the interface. The hint attribute value follows the syntax line in the function description. (optional)

tag.name: cfpdf
tag.help: Manipulates existing PDF documents. The following list describes some of the tasks you can perform with the cfpdf tag: Merge several PDF documents into one PDF document. Extract pages from multiple PDF documents and generate a new PDF document. Linearize multipage PDF documents for faster display. Encrypt or decrypt PDF files for security.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: The action to take. Must be one of the following: addwatermark deletepages getinfo merge protect read removewatermark setinfo write (required)

parameter.name: ascending
parameter.help: Order in which the PDF files are sorted: yes: files are sorted in ascending order no: files are sorted in descending order (optional, default=no)

parameter.name: copyfrom
parameter.help: The filename of the PDF document from which to copy the watermark (optional)

parameter.name: destination
parameter.help: The pathname of the modified PDF document. If the destination file exists, you must set the overwrite attribute to yes. If the destination file does not exist, ColdFusion creates it as long as the parent directory exists. (optional)

parameter.name: directory
parameter.help: Specify the directory of the PDF documents to merge. You must specify either the directory or the source. If you specify the directory, you must also specify the order. (optional)

parameter.name: encrypt
parameter.help: Specify the type of encryption used on the source PDF document: RC4_40, RC4_128M, AES_128, none (optional)

parameter.name: flatten
parameter.help: Specify whether the output file is flattened: yes: the formatting is removed and the file is flattened no: the format of the source PDF is maintained in the output file. (optional,default=no)

parameter.name: foreground
parameter.help: Specify whether the watermark is placed in the foreground of the PDF document: yes: the watermark appears in the foreground no: the watermark appears in the background (optional, default=no)

parameter.name: image
parameter.help: Specify the image used as a watermark. You can specify a filename or a ColdFusion image variable. (optional)

parameter.name: info
parameter.help: Specify the structure variable for relevant information, for example, #infoStruct#. ColdFusion ignores read only information, such as the creation date, application used to create the PDF document, and encryption parameters. (required)

parameter.name: isBase64
parameter.help: Specify whether the image used a watermark is in Base64 format: yes: the image is in Base64 format no: the image is not in Base64 format (optional, default=no)

parameter.name: keepbookmark
parameter.help: Specify whether bookmarks from the source PDF documents are retained in the merged document: yes: the bookmarks are retained no: the bookmarks are removed (optional, default=no)

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Specify the PDF document variable name, for example, myPDFdoc. If the source is a PDF document variable, you cannot specify the name attribute again; you can write the modified PDF document to the destination. (optional)

parameter.name: newownerpassword
parameter.help: Specify the password for the owner of the PDF document. (optional)

parameter.name: newuserpassword
parameter.help: Specify the password for the user of the PDF document. (optional)

parameter.name: opacity
parameter.help: Specify the opacity of the watermark. Valid values are integers in the range 0 (transparent) through 10 (opaque). (optional, default=3)

parameter.name: order
parameter.help: Specify the order in which the PDF documents in the directory are merged: name: orders the documents alphabetically time: orders the documents by timestamp (required)

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.help: Specify whether to overwrite the destination file: yes: overwrites the destination file no: does not overwrite the destination file (optional)

parameter.name: page
parameter.help: Specify page or pages in the source PDF document on which to perform the action. You can specify multiple pages as ranges separated by commas; for example, 3-10,12-18. The page attribute applies only to the watermark type for the removewatermark action. (required)

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Specify the owner or user password of the source PDF document, if it exists. (optional)

parameter.name: permissions
parameter.help: Specify the type of permissions on the PDF document: AllowPrintHigh AllowPrintLow AllowModify AllowCopy AllowAdd AllowSecure AllowModifyAnnotations AllowExtract AllowFillIn all none Except for all or none, you can specify a commaseparated list of permissions. (optional)

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: Specify the position on the page where the watermark is placed. The position represents the top-left corner of the watermark. Specify the x and y coordinates; for example 50,30. (optional)

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.help: Specify the degree of rotation of the watermark image on the page; for example, 30. (optional)

parameter.name: showonprint
parameter.help: Specify whether the watermark is printed with the PDF document: yes: the watermark is printed with the PDF document no: the watermark is not printed with the PDF document (optional)

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: Specify the source. The source can be: The pathname to a PDF document; for example, c:\work\myPDF.pdf A PDF document variable in memory that is generated by the cfdocument tag or the cfpdf tag; for example, #myPDFdoc# The binary content of PDF document variable. (required)

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Specify the type to remove from the source PDF document: attachment bookmark watermark (optional)

parameter.name: version
parameter.help: (write) Specify the version of the PDF document to write. Valid values are: 1.1 1.2 1.3 1.4 1.5 1.6 (optional)

tag.name: cfpdfform
tag.help: Manipulates existing Adobe Acrobat forms and Adobe LiveCycle forms. The following list describes some of the tasks you can perform with the cfpdfform tag: Embed an interactive Acrobat form or LiveCycle form within a PDF document. You use the cfpdfform tag to embed the PDF form within a cfdocument tag. Render an existing Acrobat form or LiveCycle form. This includes prefilling fields from a database or an XML data file and processing form data submitted via HTTP post or PDF format. Extract or prefill values in stored PDF forms and save the output to a file or use it to update a data source.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: The action to perform on the source: populate read (required)

parameter.name: datafile
parameter.help: (populate read) Pathname for the XML data file. if action="populate", the data from this file populates the fields of the PDF form. if action="read", ColdFusion writes the data to this file. You can specify a pathname relative to the context root or a relative pathname. You must specify either the datafile attribute or the result attribute for the read action; you can specify both. (optional)

parameter.name: destination
parameter.help: (populate) Pathname for the output file. You can specify an absolute pathname or a pathname relative to the context root. The file extension must be PDF or XDP. The file extension determines the format of the file. (The XDP format applies only to LiveCycle forms.) If you do not specify the destination, ColdFusion displays the form in the browser. Do not specify the destination when you embed a form in a PDF document. (optional)

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.help: (populate, read) Overwrite the destination file (if action="populate) or the data file (if action="read"): yes no (optional)

parameter.name: result
source
parameter.help: (populate, read) Pathname of the source PDF (absolute path or path relative to the context root) or byte array representing a PDF. (required)

tag.name: cfpdfformparam
tag.help: Provides additional information to the cfpdfform tag. The cfpdfformparam tag is always a child tag of the cfpdfform or cfpdfsubform tag. Use the cfpdfformparam tag to populate fields in a PDF form.

parameter.name: index
parameter.help: Specify the index associated with the field name. If multiple fields have the same name, the index value is used to locate one of them. (optional, default=1)

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: The field name on the PDF form. (requiredl)

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The value associated with the field name. For interactive fields, specify a ColdFusion variable. (optional)

tag.name: cfpdfparam
tag.help: Provides additional information for the cfpdf tag. The cfpdfparam tag applies only to the merge action of the cfpdf tag. The cfpdfparam tag is always a child tag of the cfpdf tag.

parameter.name: page
parameter.help: Specify the page or pages of the PDF source file to merge. You can specify a range of pages; for example, 1-5 , or a comma-separated list of pages; for example, 1-5,6-10,18. (optional)

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Specify the user or owner password, if the source PDF file is passwordprotected. (optional)

parameter.name: source
parameter.help: Specify the source PDF file to merge. (optional)

tag.name: cfpdfsubform
tag.help: Populates a subform within the cfpdfform tag. The cfpdfsubform tag can be a child tag of the cfpdfform tag or nested in another cfpdfsubform tag.

parameter.name: index
parameter.help: Index associated with the field name. If multiple fields have the same name, ColdFusion uses the index value is to locate one of them. (optional, default=1)

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the subform corresponding to subform name in the PDF form. (required)

tag.name: cfpresentation
tag.help: Defines the look and feel of a dynamic slide presentation. Use the cfpresentation tag as the parent tag for one or more cfpresentationslide tags, where you define the content for the presentation.

parameter.name: backgroundColor
parameter.help: Specifies the background color of the presentation. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x727971)

parameter.name: control
parameter.help: Specifies the presentation control: normal brief (optional, default=normal)

parameter.name: controlLocation
parameter.help: Specifies the location of the presentation control: right left (optional, default= right)

parameter.name: directory
parameter.help: Specifies the directory where the presentation is saved. This can be absolute path or a path relative to the CFM page. ColdFusion automatically generates the files necessary to run the presentation, including: index.htm components.swf loadflash.js viewer.swf ColdFusion stores any data files in the presentation, including images, video clips, and SWF files referenced by the cfpresentationslide tags in a subdirectory called data. To run the presentation, open the index.htm file. If you do not specify a directory, the presentation runs in the client browser. (optional)

parameter.name: glowColor
parameter.help: Specifies the color used for glow effects on the buttons. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or AF; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x35D334)

parameter.name: initialTab
parameter.help: Specifies which tab will be on top when the presentation is displayed. This applies only when the control value is normal: outline search notes (optional, default=outline)

parameter.name: lightColor
parameter.help: Specifies the light color used for light-and shadow effects. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x4E5D60)

parameter.name: overwrite
parameter.help: Specifies whether files in the directory are overwritten. Specify this attribute only when the you specify the directory. yes: overwrites files if they are already present no: create new files (optional, default=yes)

parameter.name: primaryColor
parameter.help: Specifies the primary color of the presentation. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or AF; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x6F8488)

parameter.name: shadowColor
parameter.help: Specifies the shadow color used for light-and shadow effects. The value is hexadecimal: use the form "##xxxxxx" or "##xxxxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two number signs or none. (optional, default=0x000000)
